20481194642735427051.Text: [You have failed your Oath of Silence]

1588813549227325295.Text: All is silence. The road is straight, without turning, in darkness. Now let there be an end to all things.

14849203321598615886.Text: Well. Someone finally found me. Your bad luck, really.

273715018495026709.Text: You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.

17516113621450112980.Text: Have you not given me a silver longsword? Just read the shrine and leave. I tire of your mortal presence.

455315669676314909.Text: Are you here on the pilgrimage? I take it that silver longsword is for me.

2826620668787213075.Text: Are you here on the pilgrimage? Read the shrine.

26917204122443323956.Text: Are you here on the pilgrimage? Do you have a silver longsword for me?

9287280852144018976.Text: Thank you for your help, %PCName. It looked to me like the place was safe.

838272682464818781.Text: I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. I am here to warn you: do not harm the inmates. If you come to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and take your chances with me, their Warden and Protector.

68061915855625937.Text: You have been warned. Do not harm the inmates of the Corprusarium. If you plan to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and mine.

226301925277649349.Text: Here's a little advice. No charge.

30234297002941523643.Text: Do you want a little advice? Of course you do.

412618388328515675.Text: So you're Telvanni. Then you'll understand if I offer you a little advice.

240694339168917575.Text: A little advice, outlander. Go away while you can.

184733276241518624.Text: Let me offer you a little advice, stranger.

2660324848206815003.Text: You're House Telvanni? No kidding? Well, in that case, maybe I had better give you a little advice.

12367187141688628360.Text: You want a little advice, outlander?

5751170581154322364.Text: Well, well, well. An outlander. And a Telvanni. Will wonders never cease? Then it is in the spirit of a friendly warning that I offer you a little advice.

2730917146129921276.Text: You have Cloudcleaver, my friend. I would like it back.

29300200673009117112.Text: Well, this is close enough. Thanks for your help. I suppose it's only fair that I give you your reward. Here, take them. Though it pains me to give them, you are now the owner of the Boots of Blinding Speed.

2934725773208020344.Text: I have a little advice to share with you, outlander.

257271491726010965.Text: You must be the one Relam Arinith sent.

1506124848231934131.Text: Hey! You shouldn't be back there. That's my private room.

129545582328615560.Text: Really, I can't tell you how good it is to be visible again! Thank you so much.

213672725118830350.Text: Thank you, thank you! It's so good to be able to be seen again. I just wish I had something to offer you, but I have nothing of value and no gold to speak of. It's not easy to find a job when you're invisible. Thank you again!

3530279732045529921.Text: Thank you, thank you! It's so good to be able to be seen again. I just wish I had something to offer you, but I have nothing of value and no gold to speak of. It's not easy to find a job when you're invisible. Thank you again!

310939912750020570.Text: You're wearing me skirt! How dare you wear my skirt!

29994982733319172.Text: Oh, are those my new clothes? I've waited ever so patiently for them.

712919592826332637.Text: I heard you killed my patron, Ondres Nerano. I have nothing to say to the likes of you.

2051619791523212047.Text: You here about your tower? Tell Llunela Hleran things are fine here. The work will be done soon.

3013632767171797554.Text: This is your tower, right? What do you want, %PCName?

18030301512885125116.Text: This isn't your tower and this isn't any of your business.

3187015302332632.Text: You here about the stronghold? Tell Galsa Gindu things are fine here. The work will be done soon.

8324199972553515186.Text: You the chief around here, right? What you want?

2143621465335213335.Text: This not your business here. You leave now.

13058205592685019577.Text: You here about the stronghold? Tell Dondos the work is on schedule. And he better pay me that bonus he promised.

1159117938293432234.Text: This your place? What do you want, %PCName?

307672359183044902.Text: You don't belong here, just move along.

357381562661420657.Text: Welcome to my house, %PCRace. Make yourself at home.

32232238842361930698.Text: Runa's a real gem, isn't she?

3190558963063415128.Text: Just between you and me, I always rest here between pilgrimages.

50716010272305400.Text: If you want a job here, you'll have to talk to Helviane. Excuse me.

142495423193649005.Text: Are you okay? You don't look well...

2348427924134421016.Text: Well, hello there. It's always nice to see another %PCRace.

15651222572413527697.Text: An Argonian! How exciting. I've never had an Argonian... customer.

202308843183408667.Text: Oh no, not another Khajiit. I'm still smarting from the last one.

23523322861040224446.Text: Hello there, %PCRace. Looking for a good time?

127743205155719728.Text: You'd try to steal my weapons, n'wah? Nobody cheats Lucan! Die!

23682213221278725710.Text: Ahhhh...you've removed this enchantment with your spell to cure disease!

8099179422048416076.Text: Excuse me, can you help me? No, I'm over here. My name is Cassius Olcinius. Sorry...you see, I've been made invisible by a wizard!

182391977298029994.Text: Take this, friend. I think everyone should read this leaflet. It has important information on it.

16645616668429975.Text: You are pathetic! Where is your power, vampire? You have nothing I desire. Leave me now. All I have heard about your kind is a lie.

207105452201366163.Text: I smell Berne blood on you! Die!

25867274131901607.Text: Ahhhhh! The power once again flows through my limbs! I am whole again! Now, I shall once again feed on the mortals above, pay them for my years of imprisonment! You are useless to me now, young fool. You shall be the first to die at my hands. Consider it an honor. Mastrius walks again!

3746148869655778.Text: Enough %PCName. You beat me fairly. I'll tell Dram what happened.

2644873872767714755.Text: You want another shot at me, %PCName?

277422340690713701.Text: You want a duel? You got a duel.

29932107482621229535.Text: You have slain my brother, n'wah.

22375223931675031754.Text: You have slain my brother, n'wah.

195334816294223613.Text: Come to collect more debts for cowardly smiths, %PCName?

775822370287124943.Text: I conceded. I gave you the debt money. Take it and leave.

1714021159217420843.Text: I... I concede. Take these 2000 drakes and give them to Tuveso Beloth.

22813266972175420445.Text: I'm not paying those armor repair debts.

1195581501496527750.Text: You have slain my brother, n'wah.

3043225056297124928.Text: You have slain my brother, n'wah.

22062238891067428847.Text: You have slain my brother, n'wah.

34822388670161640.Text: You have slain my brother, n'wah.

16939641270732618.Text: Oh, don't mind me. Whatever affair of honor you have with Giras Indaram, it's none of my business.

290445316827329292.Text: Darius says you can be here, so it's okay with me.

1217817362189026777.Text: You fight pretty well for a Redoran. I take back what I said about Bolvyn Venim.

683617041214825108.Text: What are you doing? Get out of there! Who sent you here? Get away!!!

130520164205134028.Text: Hello...hello? Who are you? What are you doing here? Please, you must leave.

1005432275282263484.Text: Move along, %PCRace... Wait! You're the one protecting Saprius Entius!

446421464219175108.Text: Well, %PCName, we're getting pretty close to the city, and they don't let big ol' guar like Rollie here inside the walls. Seems a shame, since he's such a personable sort. Isn't that right, Rollie? Anyway, from here, you and I can travel on to Agrippina's alone.

124908687156984366.Text: You've wasted enough of my time.

27258312461302722029.Text: You've wasted enough of my time. I'll find some other commoner to help.

1722320983117396478.Text: Move along, %PCRace... Wait! You're the one protecting Saprius Entius!

25582206412517917115.Text: Is the Scamp really gone? Thank you, whoever you are. This is all my fault.

2611214552655615104.Text: Please, whoever you are, kill the Scamp before it causes any more trouble.

26915167762113322400.Text: Thanks for getting me here safely. I'll stay here until Frald the White can get me back to Cyrodiil.

243524941249925591.Text: Shall we travel together back to Ebonheart?

1459517569177566551.Text: Thank you. We should travel together back to Frald the White in Ebonheart.

10909327311897330757.Text: Who are you? Are you in the Imperial Legion? The Ordinators have been looking for me. I've done a terrible thing. Can you... Look out! Behind you!

2204191313063028203.Text: You do not have an appointment to see Varona Nelas.

2803715265865726842.Text: Oh, dear. Another poor, unfortunate traveler, come to a bad end.

3257124060996327291.Text: I don't care who you are. I just want you out of here. Or dead.

180112992640797487.Text: I hate fighting amateurs. It takes the joy out of winning.

23783273332125922512.Text: You made a big mistake, pilgrim.

28249232292824728256.Text: I am concerned. Why have you not yet fulfilled the prophecies of the Nerevarine? Have you done something wrong? Have you forgotten your destiny? I have heard that the leader of the Temple, a man named Tholer Saryoni, is desperate, and asks that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Please. If there is some problem, go to Saryoni. Perhaps there is still hope.

12804286741127931845.Text: Why have you not yet fulfilled the prophecies of the Nerevarine? Is there something wrong? Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple has asked that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Please. If there is some problem, go to Saryoni. Perhaps there is still hope.

6174274542428523132.Text: We are concerned. Why have you not yet fulfilled the prophecies of the Nerevarine? Have you done something wrong? Have you forgotten your destiny? We hear that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is desperate, and that he asks that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Please. If there is some problem, go to Saryoni. Perhaps there is still hope.

11810145313201124359.Text: I am surprised. And a bit disappointed. I thought you were the Nerevarine? Why haven't you fulfilled the prophecies? Is something wrong? Did you do something you shouldn't? I've heard rumors that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is desperate, and that he asks that you come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. If there is some problem, maybe you should go talk to Saryoni.

1698115947203317463.Text: Well. If you are the Nerevarine, why haven't you fulfilled the prophecies? Surely you haven't forgotten. You haven't done something foolish, have you? You mustn't be shy, dumpling. I've heard that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is VERY upset, and that he is hoping that you will come speak with him at the High Fane here in Vivec City. Maybe that would be a good idea. Don't you think?

8310196942002629898.Text: I don't mean to pry into your affairs. But, if you are the Nerevarine, as they say, why haven't you fulfilled the Nerevarine prophecies? The people are badly frightened by these Sixth House disturbances. You haven't gotten yourself into any sort of trouble, have you? A discreet contact tells me that Archcanon Tholer Saryoni, the high priest of the Temple, is becoming desperate, and that he is hoping that you will come speak with him at the High Fane in Vivec City. Maybe that would be best.

29234234002085728877.Text: I see you have equipped Wraithguard. I wish you luck with it.

16986678797081721.Text: Remember. When you first equip Wraithguard, you must endure a terrible shock. Even if you are in perfect health, and have fortified your health as much as possible, you are likely to die from the shock. Don't even think about it until you are much healthier.

2913731581755124290.Text: Remember. When you first equip Wraithguard, you must endure a terrible shock. If you are not in perfect health, and have not fortified your health as much as possible, you'll be dead before you hit the ground.

3941129251677917359.Text: I have learned all I can from Kagrenac's Planbook and Kagrenac's Journals. Now, if you're still willing, I'll try to restore the mythopoeic enchantments on Wraithguard.

1131224627208315493.Text: Patience. When I have had sufficient time to review Kagrenac's Planbook and Kagrenac's Journals, I will try to restore the mythopoeic enchantments on Wraithguard.

2706411353405811543.Text: If you have really brought me Kagrenac's Planbook and Kagrenac's Journals, I can at least try to restore the mythopoeic enchantments on Wraithguard.

4037172072992822197.Text: I have nothing. Go away. Leave me in peace... but... wait. What is that you have there? Is that what I think it is? That unique dwemer artifact you have?

298158591472427873.Text: I see you've risen to %PCRank, %PCName. Word on the street is that you've become Mercius' lapdog, and he's sent you to kill me. I'm afraid I can't let that happen. You were always a disappointment.

20905124411528620205.Text: I see you've risen to %PCRank, %PCName. I also heard you've been sent to kill me. I'm the only one who'll be taking over as Guildmaster. I won't let you take my rank in the Guild!

2357520923220930356.Text: I see you've risen to %PCRank, %PCName. I'm the only one who'll be taking over as Guildmaster. I won't let you take my rank in the Guild!

7372118482917310052.Text: I thought I told you to leave.

11955291522494325335.Text: You're not supposed to be here. I'm gonna count to ten. And if you're still here when I'm done, you're gonna be in big trouble.

2188058692270815545.Text: You're not going anywhere with that Axe!

8531224241092816233.Text: You have heard my story. Do what you will.

51449342138716704.Text: Do not fear me, %PCRace. Listen, and I will tell you how I was murdered by Lugrub gro-Ogdum.

45172065601617764.Text: What are you doing here? You must be a thief!

1978721969183764879.Text: Thank you for getting me to the Ald Velothi Outpost.

1413190883195815218.Text: Who are you? Where are your papers?

103402350204808451.Text: First, let me take your identification papers. Thank you. Word of your arrival only reached me yesterday. I am %name. But my background is not important. I'm here to welcome you to Morrowind.

3009629748474023429.Text: I am %name. My background is not important. From time to time it is my duty to welcome certain visitors to Morrowind.

13530217951990214565.Text: Thank you. Don't think I ever get out of that place.

253141488988930304.Text: Greetings! M'Aiq knows many things. What is your interest? You seek knowledge. M'Aiq has much. Some of it verified by actual facts!

1046663952865110456.Text: Go away! Leave me alone! I'll never speak to you again!

1535826322130139562.Text: Never! Yield? To you? I'd rather die than yield to you, f'lah!

612166801912514587.Text: The witch is dead! Now, if you'll just give me Widowmaker, stranger, I'd appreciate it. I might be able to teach you a bit about using an axe as well, if you're interested.

1504370591030625983.Text: Yes. This is the place I need to be. They can help me here. Take this as payment, and I'll make sure to tell my friends in the Legion about your help. Thank you, friend--you have been a big help. You know, for a slaughterfish.

31423124081892923466.Text: Well, we've arrived...surprisingly enough. Here's your tip. Now leave me.

45701188175111396.Text: I should have expected as much from the likes of you. I'll be on my way now.

260020155150473988.Text: Do you have any idea where you're going at all? Have you ever even been to Ghostgate? I'm in a hurry, and you're as slow as a three-legged guar.

17557562272512616.Text: Do you even know where you're leading me? I'm not a woman accustomed to waiting. You've got one more day to get me there.

320358654270811979.Text: What's taking so long? I need to be there in the next day and a half. Hurry up, would you?

6241322051447430750.Text: No, she can't be dead! Goodbye, %PCName.

9612153832520718217.Text: Thank the gods! We've found her! I never thought I'd see her again. You finding me has truly been a blessing. Thank you so much for your help, %PCName. I wish I had more to offer you, but please take this book. It has meant so much to the two of us. I can only hope you find as much enjoyment in it as we have. Take care!

212893082913523394.Text: Thank you for your help, %PCName. Here is the payment I promised you. May all of your travels be safe.

390021445518619439.Text: Here our journey ends, %PCRace. For bringing me to this place, I thank you. It has been a thorn in the side of the Camonna Tong for too long, too long. It seems the Redguard is dead already. That is acceptable. I have no further business with you.

174264622797529038.Text: Here our journey ends, %PCRace. For bringing me to this place, I thank you. It has been a thorn in the side of the Camonna Tong for too long, too long. Be on your way, outlander, or with this Redguard, you will die. That is the choice I give you.

2222958881487514257.Text: [Rollie, being a deep thinker, has no words for now.]

17946135232584117895.Text: [Rollie gazes at you with soulful eyes, but says nothing.]

1765115840259158564.Text: [Rollie seems about to speak, but then thinks better of it.]

13851579598829437.Text: [Rollie says nothing to you at this time.]

607429923049712334.Text: Don't want to work. Just want to bang on my drum. What's a scamp gotta do?

29332313271766418503.Text: C'mon...help a scamp out. You gotta need something. I've got booze....

1668323452757422362.Text: Help me out. I need the money.

15673154051389328693.Text: Hello Caldera!!! I'm here all week!

32491129521016716230.Text: My sorrow is too great to speak anymore.

15553251161733731119.Text: Ah, well. I suppose I knew that already. Best of luck to you.

757114919241902475.Text: You've decided to help...wait. Thoronor is dead? I have no reason to go on.

15449315061470273.Text: Have you decided you'd like to help me after all?
Script: Choice "I suppose. Follow me." 1 "No. Never mind." 2

14152281813230211543.Text: This is...wait...Thoronor is dead? Oh, that's terrible. I have no reason to continue on.

16263146331418120752.Text: Why, thank you! I'm sure this will do the trick. Let's get going; I'll follow you back. Although, this would be an excellent chance to study them in great detail without being noticed....

220201511328839224.Text: Yes, we are going together to Ald Daedroth, where we will see if you have made it safe for the Ahemmusa. I will accompany you until we stand before the great statue, where we will speak further.

22810173202018316646.Text: You've spoken to the archcanon? Good. Then, is there anything else you want?

212372527952679549.Text: I'm sorry, but the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. The Nerevarine prophecies are evil superstitions, based on lies and delusions. And even if the prophecies were genuine, since you have killed one of the leaders of the Ashlander tribes, now there is no possibility that you could be accepted by the Ashlander tribes as the Nerevarine of prophecy. I'm afraid we have nothing to discuss.

56250022135219827.Text: Thank you for coming, %PCName. You know the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine. Perhaps it is time to change that doctrine.

208462687586829207.Text: We're here to discuss the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine, %PCName.

132191146483284109.Text: Thank you for coming, %PCName. You know the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine. Perhaps it is time to change that doctrine.

12261292421411327021.Text: Have you found the Ebony Mail?

27629166042270126931.Text: Have you completed the Pilgrimages of the Four Corners?

246792593266618660.Text: I'm sorry, but the Temple's doctrine on the Nerevarine is clear. I'm afraid we have nothing to discuss.

2639225453168428423.Text: I'm sorry, but we have nothing to discuss.

2557112011175523391.Text: Faith conquers all, Nerevarine. Bless your breath and blood.

29690246451877717783.Text: Are you here to request an audience, %PCRank?

78232102502120445.Text: Please leave. These are my private quarters.

10226130343113922755.Text: Faith, law, and justice. Walk on.

1592024070112572945.Text: Faith, law, and justice. Walk on.

365312161262776913.Text: So. It's you again. What brings you to visit Yagrum Bagarn, Master Crafter, and Last Living Dwarf?

768621470167948895.Text: So. It's you again. What brings you to visit Yagrum Bagarn, Master Crafter, and Last Living Dwarf?

1173513103130394974.Text: You're here for the Dwemer boots. Tell my gracious Keeper that I have done what I could. Only a Dwemer magecrafter could have done so much. But only idiots could have created these boots. It shames my race that we must be judged by the works of such lack-wit blunderers.

99541721656920991.Text: I have Lord Fyr's Dwemer boots. That's what you're here for, aren't you?

2008724402318433940.Text: Do not harm me, or you will be very sorry. I warn you. Leave me alone, and I will leave you alone.

964513448260061071.Text: I have nothing. Go away. Leave me in peace.

70001347523907832.Text: You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.

2819229767238549233.Text: You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.

17156148121317622878.Text: You have killed someone dear to me. It is a mistake you will not live to regret.

22666276122195830257.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.

3154888892292230351.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.

998123107132520093.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.

17597286202221928634.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. I cannot forget what you've done. But I will forgive you.

726128886176936754.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.

1758917131741731483.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.

2672714683174752490.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.

285914096244309965.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.

113224823642314365.Text: You have killed one of the inmates. Leave. You can live with the consequences of your actions.

14218227821660222972.Text: Hello, %PCName. How are you doing? Bit of bad news, I'm afraid. The potion doesn't seem to work on others. Tried it on two hopeless cases. Killed them outright. Deader than a garlic snail. But is there anything I can help you with?

159141733123312338.Text: A gift? For me? How thoughtful. And shrewd. I suppose you know I am a collector. And that such a gift is bound to please me. I congratulate you on your diplomatic skills. So, why have you tried to butter me up? Come to consult the great Divayth Fyr? You have the divine disease? Want to plunder the dungeon? Or leer at my daughters?

1713964751441821381.Text: A pity. I can see why you'd want to keep such a lovely relic of Dwemer culture. But now, if you'll excuse me, I have no time for idle chatter.

12986238521349227591.Text: Say. That's an interesting Dwemer piece you have there. What can you tell me about it?
Script: Choice "Offer the Dwemer artifact as a gift." 1 "Politely show him the piece, then put it away." 2

1531122898974020046.Text: Yes, yes, %PCName. You're completely cured. Did you forget something?

5956678272375208.Text: Well? Are you ready to take the potion?

31934113292128022669.Text: Well? Did you get my boots? No boots, no potion....

2369510877628230235.Text: Well! What a pleasure! A visitor! An entertaining diversion! Come to consult the great Divayth Fyr? You have the divine disease? Want to plunder the dungeon? Or leer at my daughters?

2492049788411205.Text: You again? A surprise, and a pleasure! Didn't we have a satisfactory chat? Something else you want to know about the divine disease? Eager to plunder the dungeon? Questions about my daughters?

24782174232583331520.Text: Not interesting. Sorry. Not your fault, perhaps, but you are not interesting, and I can't waste energy talking to boring people.

162417771287526700.Text: Listen. You are not interesting. No offense, but I don't want to talk to you.

627220141130279517.SpeakerCell: Tower of Tel Fyr, Hall of Fyr
627220141130279517.Text: You've killed one of us. And now it is your turn to die.

175584992882510771.Text: I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. And you have killed one of the inmates that I am sworn to protect. Prepare to receive your just punishment.

916426342400422474.Text: I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. I am here to warn you: do not harm the inmates. If you come to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and take your chances with me, their Warden and Protector.

12153204811192127890.Text: I am Vistha-Kai, Warden of the Corprusarium. I am here to warn you: do not harm the inmates. If you come to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and take your chances with me, their Warden and Protector.

587321661882910936.Text: You have been warned. Do not harm the inmates of the Corprusarium. If you plan to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and mine.

27903224152710914508.Text: You have been warned. Do not harm the inmates of the Corprusarium. If you plan to plunder the dungeon, you must endure their attacks, and mine.

894025132636124736.Text: I suppose you want to speak to Divayth Fyr? Have you got corprus disease? Or were you planning to plunder the dungeon?

234230262787817508.Text: Go talk to Divayth Fyr. He's the one you're looking for.

12625656356661144.Text: Have you come to plunder the dungeon? Or have you got corprus disease? Or did you come to see Divayth Fyr? I'm Beyte Fyr. I'm the wife of Divayth Fyr. One of them. Sort of.

3109819437275595223.Text: Are you here to plunder the dungeon? Have you got corprus disease? Did you want to talk to Divayth Fyr?

16505142141215915016.Text: My name is Delte Fyr. Did you want to see Divayth Fyr? Have you got corprus disease? Or are you another questing hero looking to plunder the dungeon?

21081215651840014044.Text: If you have corprus disease, you need the Corprusarium. Or do you want Divayth Fyr?

111099892177678622.Text: You're new here, aren't you? My name is Uupse. Uupse Fyr. I take care of the corprus victims in the Corprusarium.

133012756320302114.Text: I see you found a guarskin drum.

3115725581315842788.Text: Make yourself at home. I have some things to do.

217327444224457526.Text: Thanks for getting me back to Maar Gan, %PCName.

2483913161722097.Text: Do you want me to wait here?

921824214617320973.Text: Shall we travel together back to Maar Gan?

2159581483253221356.Text: We're on the way to Pelagiad, %PCName. Tell me if you no longer want to travel together.

28758230782144811420.Text: We're on the way back to Novor Drethan, %PCName. Tell me if you no longer want to travel together.

10737815943294447.Text: The blight is gone, and we have survived. Now we must dedicate ourselves to rebuilding the Temple. And you must dedicate yourself to your responsibilities as Protector of Morrowind.

245803040437511662.Text: I expected you. We have business, you and I.

166552843338625147.Text: You have come uninvited. I have nothing to say to you.

22112111712176419568.Text: It began here. It will end here. Have you any parting words? Or would you prefer to skip the speeches, and get to our business. You are the challenger here, after all. So to you goes the courtesy of the first blow.

2190322223223052000.Text: Have you something more to say?

1671715344190492888.Text: It began here. It will end here. Have you any parting words? Or would you prefer to skip the speeches, and get to our business. You are the challenger here, after all. So to you goes the courtesy of the first blow.

1453257882975315967.Text: Have you something more to say?

305361363183812110.Text: Strange. This outcome I did not foresee. That you would come unprepared.

19642283041589325887.Text: Until I see you better prepared, we have nothing to discuss.

2664023040146732706.Text: Quickly! Did you want to meet the archcanon?

1788966312321918569.Text: [whispers] No. Didn't you read the note? Until you are named Hortator by the three Houses and Nerevarine by the four tribes, there is no point in discussing your claims. Now... go away before someone sees us talking.

21902236681720919358.Text: Thank you for your help, %PCName. As promised, here is your payment.

1686216588272753343.Text: Clearly, you don't know where you're going. You've wasted two days of my time, and now I won't make it to Koal Cave on time. Thanks for nothing.

302042221916470854.Text: Are you sure you know the way to Koal Cave? I need to be there in the next half day.

3748227741586120463.Text: It's already been a day that I've been traveling with you, and I'll need to be there within another day. Can we get moving?

14442671292630647.Text: As I've told you, I need to be in Koal Cave in the next day and a half. Let's be on our way.

316948654723513950.Text: Yes, yes, sera. Yes, we are here safely. And this fine man, he is to be my bridegroom?

1372422887257055964.Text: Yes, %PCName. Are you ready now to travel together to Zainab camp?

16538300371313719685.Text: Yes, %PCName. We travel together to Zainab camp. When we arrive there, we will speak further about my new bridegroom.

3038427842789421995.Text: You're just here to loot the shrine, right? That's fine with us. Just be careful. Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone.

1994023638165959738.Text: You're just here to loot the shrine, right? That's fine with us. Just be careful. Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone.

29283234563212712126.Text: You're just here to loot the shrine, right? That's fine with us. Just be careful. Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone.

340260503072030002.Text: Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone. Okay?

8442177981262122153.Text: Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone. Okay?

2142517917119083534.Text: Leave us alone, and we'll leave you alone. Okay?

677243903027217529.Text: Who are you, outlander? And what are you doing here?

25981793133192201.Text: Who are you, outlander? And what are you doing here?

812125951736414995.Text: Who are you, outlander? And what are you doing here?

1974415012532320253.Text: Wanna drink, buddy? Got anything you want, so long as it's sujamma.

29920284962426431029.Text: Back again? I dunno, pal. You look like you've had plenty. Or maybe you ALWAYS look that way.

6916295372987327138.Text: Back already? Well, go ahead, drink up. It's free.

16638405123153970.Text: Well, well, well. What do we have here? Do you have your invitation? Are you a Player of the Game? Or one of the Game Pieces? Or a humble Spectator?

45734515193616635.Text: Everything is perfectly all right. We heard the word. Hlireni Indavel says lay off you and the savages. We won't touch them, or you, as long as you leave us alone. [Whispers: Spoil-sport.]

2400522477179779807.Text: Everything is perfectly all right. We heard the word. Hlireni Indavel says lay off you and the savages. We won't touch them, or you, as long as you leave us alone. [Whispers: Spoil-sport.]

1961528148943530578.Text: Don't worry. Hlireni Indavel says leave you and the poor starving Ashlanders alone.

1657476082311026289.Text: Don't worry. Hlireni Indavel says leave you and the poor starving Ashlanders alone.

295856079266545176.Text: I don't know you, do I? Are you here for the dance? Or are you here with the gold-hats?

152054898476912210.Text: I don't know you, do I? Are you here for the dance? Or are you here with the gold-hats?

1597649523088514567.Text: Come on. Get into the spirit of things. You want to tumble?

17177102673117730664.Text: Come on. Get into the spirit of things. You want to tumble?

18116283481293817355.Text: %PCRank %PCName. You are not allowed in here. You must leave. Immediately. And without hesitation. If you do not leave immediately, peacefully, we will use force, and I will not be responsible for your safety.

1333558251882424008.Text: %PCRank %PCName. With all due respect, you have no authority here. I don't know what you think you're doing, but you won't do it on my watch. If you do not leave immediately, I cannot be responsible for your safety.

1731627089245027079.Text: I don't care who you are, or why you're here. No one comes in here without proper authorization. Now, get out, while you can.

1357629128158639483.Text: Someone is going to going to regret this mistake. Dearly.

304399778346230137.SpeakerCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
304399778346230137.Text: I don't care WHO you are, %PCRank. You don't belong in here. So get out. Right now. Don't make me use force.

2028911163146954254.SpeakerCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing

1540613049217281628.SpeakerCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
1540613049217281628.Text: %PCRank %PCName. I don't like this at all. This is completely against procedures. But I don't seem to have much choice. The key is in the Inquisitor's office. But the guards are not going to like it. Not one bit.

1057157272487820569.SpeakerCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
1057157272487820569.Text: The key? I told you. It's in the Inquisitor's office.

723725462562425809.SpeakerCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing

2053119133245948680.Text: %PCRank %PCName. This is against procedures. And you know it. Get out of here. Immediately.

1857834672739819667.Text: I told you. Get out of here. Now!

13857194313057721050.Text: %PCRank %PCName. This is against procedures. And you know it. Go ahead. The key is in the desk. But I have to report this. Immediately.

19102114942159319135.Text: The key is in the desk. Go ahead. I'm not going to stop you.

94063232412134166.SpeakerCell: Ministry of Truth, Hall of Processing
94063232412134166.Text: Poor dumb bastard. Now I have to break another mother's heart.

24835183512938719766.Text: %PCRank %PCName. You know this is against procedures. I can't let you just walk in here. Please. You have to leave.

10701122404215080.Text: Didn't you hear me? I said, you have to leave. You're not supposed to be in here. Get out, immediately, or I'll have to use force.

3248520215213614558.Text: %PCRank %PCName. You know this is against procedures. I do this under protest. The key is in the desk. I don't know how the others are going to take it. But I don't mind telling you -- I don't like it one bit.

4453224052109529889.Text: I SAID... the key is in the desk. Get on with it.

18775105223220719174.SpeakerCell: Vivec, Hall of Justice Secret Library
18775105223220719174.Text: You shouldn't be in here. You'd better leave.

2710511186122018310.Text: You're not supposed to be in here. Get out. Now.

439770332633661.Text: Beneath Red Mountain, Lord Dagoth sleeps. But when he wakes, we all shall rise, and the dust will blow away. Serve your Lord, Dagoth Ur. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.

21303172802354119425.Text: He said you would come to us. And he was right. Have you come to submit? Or come to die?

2215529462764623100.Text: So. Have you decided? Have you come to submit? Or come to die?

5562177692283826616.Text: %PCName. Star-blessed hero? Or the Daedra's Pawn? Only one way to find out. If you have the courage.

2714312089177516612.Text: I'm a sportsman. I'll give you a fighting chance. Go ahead. Make the first move.

2113134302501210239.Text: Look! It's Azura's Fool! Look at you. Not a real thing at all. Just a pathetic puppet of prophecy. And you think you can trust the Daedra Lords?

15284121342264030153.Text: Come on! You're the prophesied Incarnate! Azura has promised you fame and glory! Surely you can't be afraid of me, can you? Don't be shy. With a Daedra Lord for ally and patron, how could you lose? Oh, PLEASE don't hurt me, star-blessed hero!

1751832505196081433.Text: What are you doing? You have no idea. Poor animal. You struggle and fight, and understand nothing.

9333138913204321599.Text: A bug. A weed. A piece of dust. Busy, busy, busy.

1132280562115717972.Text: What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.

9182100292113015600.Text: For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.

3128029174250353888.Text: What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.

2528767161801528932.Text: For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.

866528276202171347.Text: What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.

2282523054443129879.Text: For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.

5239278322309231516.Text: What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.

31514197133829476.Text: For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.

15861218371456629510.Text: What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.

15426187532210112703.Text: For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.

1999925547677631056.Text: WHERE ARE YOU, LORD? We cannot hear you.... SPEAK to us! PLEASE!

2526318491142119756.Text: What are you? Where is this place? I'm so tired, LET ME SLEEP!

871924153233305675.Text: The chairs. The tables. All confused. We hear the words, and must speak them. We take them, and arrange them, but still, they will not be quiet.

119218036544414858.Text: Everything is wrong. This is not straight. This is too high. This is in my way. We must put them right.

25063262232278625555.Text: We do not fear death. Life is a dream. Blood is a dream. We sleep in one soul, the soul of Lord Dagoth.

2351528666292513712.Text: What are you? Nothing. Why are you here? You do not know.

99261814580441073.Text: You have betrayed Lord Dagoth. Taste his vengeance.

30468157711655810188.Text: You will die, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.

15604253692368232577.Text: We have you in our eye, %PCName. We see you, waking and sleeping.

2944922372226625958.Text: We see you, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.

25738247542214816949.Text: What are you doing? You have no idea. Poor animal. You struggle and fight, and understand nothing.

1699342602946520428.Text: A bug. A weed. A piece of dust. Busy, busy, busy.

2769788482274927645.Text: At the lonely hour of midnight, I fly, when stars are weeping. Beneath the echo of souls, my spirit sleeping.

11542311312853310177.Text: Fire, poisons, claws, pincers, wheels... what slave knows what the lover feels?

3145293433052831699.Text: What? What use is speech? If you will not submit, you must be destroyed.

10860266231818912341.Text: For our fallen brother, we claim our revenge.

7324111912996526472.Text: I have you in my eye. I see you, %PCName, and my Lord sees you.

30564111011238812877.Text: Your are welcome, %PCName. You are in no danger.

370823057508312336.Text: The chairs. The tables. All confused. We hear the words, and must speak them. We take them, and arrange them, but still, they will not be quiet.

17098198591695618025.Text: Everything is wrong. This is not straight. This is too high. This is in my way. We must put them right.

1609219953294783081.Text: We do not fear death. Life is a dream. Blood is a dream. We sleep in one soul, the soul of Lord Dagoth.

525819160304928801.Text: What are you? Nothing. Why are you here? You do not know.

134537321246894897.Text: WHERE ARE YOU, LORD? We cannot hear you.... SPEAK to us! PLEASE!

545325463627930906.Text: What are you? Where is this place? I'm so tired, LET ME SLEEP!

62371108813909003.Text: You've done well to come this far. I don't think we have anything to talk about, do we? Then let's get on with it.

986629974255239995.Text: I'm not here to talk. I'm here to fight.

59396079277454960.Text: Oh, just shut up, will you?

549230794718028227.Text: No. I'm sorry. No flowery speeches. No subtle tricks. No formal boasts or challenges. Fight. Or leave. But don't expect me to pass the time of day with you.

601248381263916438.Text: I greet you, %PCName. Or Nerevar. Or whoever you are. I'm Dagoth Endus, brother of Dagoth Ur, and lord of Citadel Endusal. Would you like a little ancient Dagoth brandy?

1591225561288529126.Text: Yes, %PCName. Before we fight, can I offer you a little ancient Dagoth brandy?

1031031522181778313.Text: What? You want to talk? You want to surrender? To boast? To talk me to death?

2335519473257483061.Text: Go ahead, windbag. Talk, talk, talk. Anything to delay your coming defeat.

1261719499778122631.Text: Well, %PCName. Have you come to serve? Or to challenge my station? Or to try to win Keening?

2538918382060431000.Text: Consider, %PCName. Where do your best interests lie? It is not too late to serve....

7515207672663932667.Text: The Sixth House greets you, Lord Nerevar. Or %PCName, as you call yourself. I am known as Dagoth Gares, priest of Ilunibi Shrine, and minister to Sixth House servants. My Lord, Dagoth Ur, has informed me of your coming. I wish that this time you had come to honor your Lord's friendship, not to betray it.

101272241198164547.Text: Yes, Lord Nerevar? What would you ask of me? Would you hear of my Lord, Dagoth Ur? Or of the Sixth House, or of Sixth House servants?

150816851312507738.Text: The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."

16827207742654928769.Text: The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

1521292812717910184.Text: The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. 3970206422647012983.Text: The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. Your host has called you, %PCName, but you have refused his hospitality. This is what my Lord would say to you. "I have opened my Heart to you. I was generous. Yet you defy me. I regret that you must be destroyed, but none shall stand against me in the hour of my awakening."

2528519293960621012.Text: The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory. You have defied my Lord Dagoth, and his judgement is death. Flee, and hide, or die where you stand.

20534199356583829.Text: You have betrayed Lord Dagoth. Taste his vengeance.

1218617737654322045.Text: You will die, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.

15530263941652121194.Text: We see you, false one. Your flesh will feed us all.

2591715015202587515.Text: We have you in our discerning eye, %PCName. We see you, waking and sleeping.

2580016962292434560.Text: Beneath Red Mountain, Lord Dagoth has awakened. Now Sleepers and Dreamers all are risen, and the dust is blown away. Come to your Lord, Dagoth Ur. The Sixth House is risen, and Dagoth is its glory.

13485155191958727289.Text: Can we get moving, %PCRace? We've a long way to go.

206530333281032270.Text: Okay, %PCName, we've made it. I thank you for your help, and Rollie would if he were allowed in the city. I really must speak with someone about that. Think how much he'd enjoy visiting this place. He'd be talking about it for days. Oh, I suppose you're wondering about compensation for your trouble?

28689412196788612.Text: You have slain one of my tribe. You must pay with your life.

221921947665463494.Text: You have slain one of my tribe. You must pay with your life.

16418923815257837.Text: You have slain one of my tribe. You must pay with your life.

19294183501106417663.Text: Are you here to join the Imperial Legion?

2350315055279237208.Text: You're out of uniform. Talk to me when you're serious.

97142792310825007.Text: I'm glad to see you again, %PCName.

1280623352998326775.Text: What? Another man? Guards! Oh, it's you again. You have my vote, %PCName. But I think it's time for you to leave.

14480262131930424578.Text: You again! What do you want this time?

3102932226505311332.Text: Have you taken care of House Telvanni yet, %PCRank %PCName?

236115187162469914.Text: So, have you gathered the votes of the other councilors?

16025235152663195.Text: Oh. Goody, goody. Are you going to show me that thing you did again?

1733844432470019051.Text: What can I do for you, master?

190592792723126084.Text: What are you doing here? Those bastards kicked me out of the Legion...and for what? Idiots, all of them. I'm surprised the fools even knew it was gone. But it's mine now. And that's how it will stay. And you will tell no one!

19137490125553988.Text: Ah, %PCName. Friend of the Temple, and healer of Mournhold. What can I do for you?

1009424795316348028.Text: Have you any news about the Crimson Plague, %PCName?

23349198911001418656.Text: Were you able to help Shunari, %PCName?

1007531851272425485.Text: Fedris Hler must be told of this attack. Get yourself to the Temple and let him know! Go!

5334592853117777.Text: This attack must be reported. We will stay here and guard against further attacks. Go tell Tienius Delitian! Run!

14849113951948725073.Text: Someone must make sure Fedris Hler is informed of these attacks. I cannot leave my post. Tell him!

1587512302549221737.Text: Someone must make sure Tienius Delitian is informed of these attacks. I cannot leave my post. Tell him!

91225785155918695.Text: Mournhold is under attack! Take arms and armor to Plaza Brindisi Dorom -- they need your help!

28792104583252322149.Text: They're attacking the city! Don't just stand there! DO something!

3014115110938721232.Text: You are a wanted criminal, and will be punished. You stand here only by the Lady's mercy. Take great care, lest you meet the Hands.

233813539948315535.Text: You wear the sacred garb of the Ordinator, but you are not of the Order. I stay my hand solely at the Lady's discretion. Speak with me no more.

23407321083087418600.Text: We await the Goddess' command. Her word is our law. There is no time to speak with the likes of you.

16453229471830414457.Text: I suggest you go help Shunari, and quickly at that. She may have information we need to figure out what's going on.

1536320159124722775.Text: I heard noises from downstairs. What's happened?

973293382371111408.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Fons Beren!

298267197212171736.Text: %PCName, there is much to discuss. It seems the situation is more serious than I'd expected. I've examined the rat you see here, and I've detemined what infected it - the Crimson Plague.

2581885482901220945.Text: I've told you I want no further contact with you. I'll handle this on my own. Please leave.

12006267581751212930.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Sunel Hlas!

1111624057209734334.Text: Have you delivered that Cure Disease Potion, %PCName? I'd be grateful if you've done me that favor.

1806622863480724889.Text: I've told you I want no further contact with you. I'll handle the situation on my own. Please leave.

253731601473417163.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Goval Ralen!

25769227381620713852.Text: This is a serious turn of events, %PCName. Perhaps I've underestimated what's going on here. May I ask another favor of you?

2750251442208031984.Text: You're armed? Good! Help the guard! Destroy these devices!

166752136261372630.Text: Welcome back, %PCName. Have you been able to deliver that Cure Disease Potion?

2509716915230410303.Text: Mournhold is under attack! Monsters have broken into Plaza Brindisi Dorom! You're armed! Go help them!

167453146549749161.Text: Have you heard? The city is under attack! Enchanted machines have burst into Plaza Brindisi Dorom and are killing everyone! They need your help! GO!

9828084267117937.Text: Okay, okay. Just give us some time to work something out. Now get out of here, or else Dovor might get suspicious.

2658211338272011690.Text: Mournhold is under attack! They've mobilized the guard and militia! All able-bodied citizens should report to Plaza Brindisi Dorom, armed and armored, immediately!

9535256072705213574.Text: Plaza Brindisi Dorom is under attack! They've called out the Guard, but they're outnumbered! Go! They need your help!

116199626463516968.Text: We're under attack! Go to Plaza Brindisi Dorom -- hurry!

412032117100752489.Text: What's this about the Dark Brotherhood? You say you've been attacked by them? The fact that you're standing here seems to suggest otherwise.

1205925765578328022.Text: My greetings and blessings upon you. I am Eno Romari. How may I help you in your journey through this life?

9181221672803716176.Text: You again? Already made you a good blade. Stop bugging me.

232585731902213449.Text: Yeah, you're the one who wanted me to forge the blade. I suppose you figure I'm finished, huh?

11643838329977535.Text: Yeah, you're the one who wants me to forge the blade for you. And you apparently want to bother me. What?

17439772915131578.Text: What do you want? I'm here to make weapons, not to chat.

1842725074327928094.Text: You have no place here, child of living flesh. The Mazed Band must not be allowed to leave this tomb. The Band should never have existed at all. That was my folly, and this is my curse. For all eternity, I am damned to walk in this half life, to keep my creation from destroying the hearts and minds of mortals. Those who would challenge my fate will pay with their lives.

10178174141161414728.Text: Hold! I am beaten. You are the greater warrior, %PCName. You should speak now with my liege.

2720923242218723111.Text: Look, I don't know what's going on in this place. Monsters bursting up from the ground, guards running around everywhere...this is lunacy. You'll notice I'm not blaming this on any witch. And it's still too hot around here.

2718223277727823763.Text: What're you looking at? No, I'm not paralyzed. And I've never even met a witch, much less been asked to escort one anywhere. Why am I naked? Because it's too damned hot here! You people think that every time you see a naked Nord barbarian, he's been tricked by some witch. So narrow minded. Now leave me alone.

2901239213273929326.Text: I told you I don't need any help. I'm just trying to cool off a bit. I've never even seen a witch! You people and your stereotypes....

987224391161826740.Text: I understand you've been to the Clockwork City, and you alone returned. You've consorted with gods, what can this Queen do for you?

77834044598821259.Text: It seems you are destined for great things in Morrowind, my friend. I'm glad there will be another for people to talk about.

25094314473257210993.Text: My protector! It seems you were able to take care of that ridiculous plot.

376830472581719445.Text: Hello again, friend %PCName. There is so much you seem to be involved with. How can I help you?

170085781136126647.Text: How goes your quest to forge the Blade of Nerevar?

31442153534624987.Text: Good to see you, %PCName. What can one who has defeated the mighty Karrod wish to speak about?

2639423835774413431.Text: You are to fight the mighty Karrod soon, %PCname. Do you really have the time to be chatting with me?

16236260881569729375.Text: Why, hello! My protector has returned! What is it I can do for you, my friend?

3153951762727716917.Text: So, what information have you uncovered about this mysterious plot my son believes is afoot?

11784322952904929896.Text: Hello again. I trust things are going well for you.

3124715213454712040.Text: These are frightening times, friend %PCName. What is it you require?

8086903206583467.Text: Good day to you. How may I help you, %PCName?

7549132101964414265.Text: Greetings %PCName. I've been wanting to speak with you. I understand you've been performing some duties for Tienius, and you've done well. I believe there are other matters you should investigate as well.

26338606898955068.Text: Ahh...you are the one recently arrived from Vvardenfell. What is it you wish to ask?

32030123861369128082.Text: You have other matters you wish to discuss with me? Please, go ahead.

14414800273383779.Text: What may Karrod do for you, mighty one?

272714451765025852.Text: Speak with my King Helseth, my friend. We can speak more when your business with him is complete.

46682916266061132.Text: Greetings. How may I help you?

28444148402683010010.Text: Hello! What can I do for you?

615253712645329753.Text: My mother, Queen Barenziah, has been found dead. I understand you were seen near her chambers. You will not leave here alive.

1228819430358418974.Text: Greetings, %PCName. There is much still to be done for the people of Morrowind, and I believe we will both be needed. How may I help you?

29638582139344313.Text: I have been hearing many stories about you, %PCName. And about the goddess. In fact,  I've been hearing stories about a great deal of strange happenings in my city. I sent you to learn more about the attacks. I will assume that the rumors I have heard relate to that.

21024265233160711929.Text: Yes, %PCName? I thought you were sent to learn more about the attacks. I also told you to stay away from the Royal Palace until you had learned all there is to know! Do not take this job lightly.

26180161471138016613.Text: You have questions about my plans for you?

1973305802614219175.Text: Enough! I have seen you fight my champion, though I find it hard to imagine how you have succeeded. I did not believe anyone could best Karrod, but you have shown me otherwise. And he speaks! There are depths to you, %PCName, that I will fathom in time. For now, you have proven yourself to me.

1060915791226967812.Text: Have you come to fight my champion? Are you prepared to face Karrod?

2456069213170710951.Text: It is not yet time to fight my champion. Return later, and we will have the battle.

113559063167310419.Text: Have you come to be of service to your King?

17791179462890825496.Text: I understand you were able to protect Barenziah.

1371921979280879346.Text: Your job is to protect Barenziah. See to it.

67231010458197918.Text: Ahhh...%PCName. Have you learned more about that plot?

2821024365195009320.Text: Ah...so you're the one Tienius has been telling us about. I had wished to speak with you, but I have learned that my mother, the Queen Barenziah, has been found dead. And you were seen near her chambers near the time of her death. I cannot let you leave here alive.

28084105921128822127.Text: Ah...so you're the one Tienius has been telling us about. You should have brought the information to us directly. Still, you may be of use. We understand you had a slight inconvenience earlier. It appears we were given a bit of misinformation. The Queen Mother has spoken of you as well.

1679333702391623246.Text: Ah...so you're the one Tienius has been telling us about. Interesting. You'll have to forgive us for the slight inconvenience earlier. It appears we were given a bit of misinformation. The Queen Mother has spoken of you as well.

186522861571073658.Text: You would dare approach us without being granted an audience? Guards!

196031547731217295.Text: You've got your shiny blade. Now leave an old spirit to his haunts!

13037243571921928976.Text: You find that Pyroil Tar yet?

15051289481993827866.Text: What're you doing down here? Leave an old spirit to his haunts.

138158770274192884.Text: It is done. Please, can we return to the Temple now?

23556283961432120608.Text: I am attempting to cleanse the Shrine. Please, don't interrupt me.

19484821151722481.Text: I will now cleanse the Shrine of the Dead, I suppose. If I can. Be with me, Lady.

3167691372118632605.Text: You have killed the Profane? Please take me to the Shrine of the Dead.

348522497222234494.Text: Hello. I'm told you will accompany me to the Shrine of the Dead and protect me as we travel together. Our Lady commands it...so I suppose we must go.

4212174613143018784.Text: Yes? M-must we travel together? Or may I wait here? Or go home? Please?

21003616694821398.Text: Oh...hello. Have we met? I'm Urvel Dulni, a recent Initiate here at the Temple.

20822194483092732573.Text: Oh...hello. Have we met? I'm Urvel Dulni, a recent Initiate here at the Temple.

1589878461519830507.Text: I'm afraid that I have nothing for you, %PCName. You will need to speak with the Lady Almalexia if you have further questions.

27110279162244231934.Text: What is it? I have been told of no tasks that you may perform in the Lady Almalexia's service.

22509268713264720427.Text: You're to retrieve Barilzar's Mazed Band, are you not?

1914634691446713764.Text: Ahhh...Fedris sent you to me, did he? You would like to know more about Barilzar's Mazed Band? I suppose I can tell you something.

83485703714515887.Text: Yes...have you come to be of service to our Lady?

276041744422430830.Text: What is it? Have you settled that business with the Shrine of the Dead?

18931167982061718957.Text: Hmmm...yes. You are the one that Hler mentioned. Interesting. You are to be of service to our Lady. It is essential, and all would be displeased were you to fail.

363223804244536677.Text: What is it you need? I have no more jobs for you, but the Lady Almalexia has informed me that you may report to her directly.

3110518631293119640.Text: Have you been able to investigate the disturbance further?

1020187692984913978.Text: I understand you've spoken to Delitian about the attacks on the city. He is correct in having you investigate the disturbance, but you should bring any information you find to me. This is a Temple city, and this is a Temple matter. We will deal with it.

254957892251164441.Text: I've heard about the attacks on the city. Good that you reported them to me, though. I've sent some High Ordinators to deal with the situation. You can help me in another way. I want you to investigate the disturbance.

7648247737625997.Text: Have you retrieved Barilzar's Mazed Band?

1461824651463326415.Text: Drin sent you to me? Priests...hmph. As it happens, there is another way you may be of service to our Lady Almalexia.

58802741427947025.Text: Yes...what is it you want? I heard you'd taken care of that shrine business. Go speak with Drin. He seems to like you.

1201522481203689679.Text: Yes? Aren't you supposed to be dealing with the Shrine of the Dead?

20078199952732320244.Text: It's you again. I suppose you wish to be of further service to our Lady?

532422848489831950.Text: Well, what's the status with the goblin army? Have you taken care of it yet?

2134210292030117878.Text: Ahh...you're the one who has recently arrived in Mournhold from Vvardenfell. I was told of your arrival. I understand you had some problems with the Dark Brotherhood. An interesting group...and usually rather effective. I'm surprised you're still alive. Perhaps you have potential, or they sent incompetents. I believe you might be of service to our Lady.

61719362674813124.Text: You would dare enter the lair of the Dark Brotherhood? Very well. We will complete our mission here and now. A speedy death to you, %PCName.

6294200742210021097.Text: Hello, friend. Are you seeking transport to Mournhold again?

933264661939224907.Text: It is time for you to go, %PCName. Sotha Sil must be stopped.

30574862084628886.Text: Greetings, my dearest servant. You were to forge the blade of Nerevar once again.

302463345151697838.Text: Welcome, %PCName. It is time we talked of greater things. I have watched you since your arrival in Vvardenfell, and you have been a strong and faithful servant to me. None but the Nerevarine could have succeeded as you have. How long I have waited for this! My Nerevar, returned to me at last! I have watched from my Temple as others have made the claim, and I have seen them fall. I believe now that you are the one who was prophesied.

12312192372035210158.Text: Have you eliminated the threat of my poor, mad Missing Hand, and brought peace to Mournhold?

907110961059216987.Text: I am well-pleased, good and faithful servant. My people look upon the elements, and see there written a divine testament to my lordship. Did ever any other god display such dominion over the earth and sky? But now... with a heavy heart, I must lay a sad burden upon you. I bid you bring the peace of understanding to my Missing Hand.

3054323903630732288.Text: In My wisdom I have sent you to activate the Karstangz-Bcharn. Tell me you have accomplished this task for your goddess.

2273416391250530389.Text: What have you learned about this End of Times cult and their beliefs? Have you served me well in gathering this information?

2133727145141422476.Text: Greetings, %PCName. It is good to see you again. Dear Fedris has told me more about your work so far here in Mournhold. He suggested I might find your services useful. After some consideration, I have decided that there may be a task for you to complete.

6830315912603923009.Text: I sense that the danger in the Plaza has abated...for now. Go and speak with Fedris Hler. He will give you further instructions.

2272532113259665328.Text: There is a disturbance in the Plaza Brindisi Dorom. Investigate it, my good and faithful servant. I shall remain here.

1749731902210821374.Text: There is much work to be done. Leave me now, my loyal servant. We will speak again soon, I am sure.

13313293452598624177.Text: So you are the person I have been hearing about. I welcome you to my chapel, %PCName...or perhaps I should call you by another name? But, that is a discussion for a later time. I understand you have done well in my service, and, indeed, a service in my name is a service for all of Mournhold. Now, my faithful and obedient servant, let us discuss Barilzar's Mazed Band.

17364105782712117012.Text: Yes? Do you seek transport to Vvardenfell?

102718341511914935.Text: Greetings, friend, what may I do for you?

18560219622285116229.Text: So there was ANOTHER Velas wizard living in the Velas Manor, eh, %PCName? Brother of the weedy one you killed. And a tough wizard, from what I hear. It's a funny old world, isn't it?

60519253222018403.Text: I saw your fight with that wizard, %PCName. That certainly was interesting. I expected, with all the rumors of how powerful and evil he was, that he would be tougher than he appeared. Hmm. He did say his name was Velas, right? There's a Velas manor in Godsreach. Perhaps checking it out would shed some much needed light on this mystery.

2380318072475011040.Text: Salutations, %PCName. So nice of you to join me in my humble abode. I was all prepared to offer you a nice drink or a bite to eat before we got down to business, but you are late in coming and I don't appreciate being kept waiting, so business it shall be. I can sense you've already made the acquaintance of my unfortunate brother.

24805288101903726631.Text: Greetings, %PCRace. Perhaps you'd like to hear the latest rumors?

2043809244472246.Text: Greetings, fair citizens of Mournhold! I am the great, renowned, respected, and feared wizard, Ovis Velas! In the coming weeks you shall see more and more of me, as I bring this city to its knees. But for the moment, allow me to demonstrate my power on one of your hapless countrymen. You there! Yes, you, you ugly %PCRace. Prepare yourself to feel my wrath!

13529158561765110907.Text: Don't be tiresome. I have no time for idle chatter with the likes of you.

12692233882245831534.Text: Are you speaking to me, %PCRace? I suppose you want some armor or steel something-or-another, right? Well, why don't you take your sniveling looks and your ungrateful tone and talk directly to the smith? I'm "just an apprentice." I've got nothing to offer the likes of you. I don't belong here.

2456347492827431491.Text: Hello again, %PCName. I'm loving this job. Thanks so much for recommending it to me! It sure beats those blasted pillows!

2230985241413310476.Text: Hey there, %PCName! I got the job! Thanks so much for recommending this to me. It's hard work, but I just imagine that every breastplate or shield I turn out is just a thin, hard pillow made of metal, and I get through the day just fine. Here, I don't have much money, but I can offer you some tools that might come in handy.  Also talk to my boss, Bols. He's pretty happy at having a new apprentice, and will give you some good deals.

297951809428318105.Text: Damn that Ilnori Faustus! Damn him!

29468144961074183.Text: Thank you so much for sending Therdon my way, %PCName. He's a tremendous help around the place, even if I can't ever get him to shut up about the blasted pillows! Now, can I interest you in my custom armor?

20563277641573612233.Text: Thank you so much for sending Therdon my way, %PCName. He's a tremendous help around the place, even if I can't ever get him to shut up about the blasted pillows! Now, can I interest you in my custom armor?

916859172315510092.Text: Thank you for mentioning that job opportunity at the smithy's to me, %PCName. I hope to check it out very soon, as soon as I finish my shein.

2281332340155617523.Text: Hello, %PCRace, and welcome to my shop. Have you come to order a piece of my famous custom armor? I see you've already made the acquaintance of my "charming" apprentice, Ilnori Faustus.

6179184361782030176.Text: Hello, %PCRace, and welcome to my shop. Have you come to order a piece of my famous custom armor? I notice you've had the misfortune to meet my "charming" apprentice, Ilnori Faustus.

2673721903040710713.Text: Hello, %PCRace, and welcome to my shop. Have you come to order a piece of my famous custom armor?

3158572402407717607.Text: Hi there, %PCRace. Care to drink away your troubles with me?

357229964134772252.Text: Sorry, there, %PCRace. I don't have any spare change.

6039182992691014462.Text: Get away from me, you slackjawed, flea-bitten %PCRace.

21410281141082331562.Text: Thank you for helping me with Holmar, %PCName.

26991167372129416788.Text: That was quite satisfying, %PCName. I'm sorry I had to involve you this way, but I'm glad this problem is taken care of once and for all. Please accept this money as a sign of my gratitude.

22544289573164627407.Text: That was quite satisfying, %PCName. I'm sorry I had to involve you this way, but I'm glad this problem is taken care of once and for all. Please accept this money as a sign of my gratitude.

11892250202658622037.Text: As much as I would like to bash his kwama-cuttle-infested head in, I have to hand it to you, %PCName. That was some smooth handling. I doubt he'll be back here any time soon. I don't have much to give in thanks, but here, take this money.

42462052925772359.Text: Thank you for showing me the true way of faith, %PCRace. All praise Vivec!

6163123021785315804.Text: Let's go get that scrib-sucking Nord before he leaves the bar, %PCName.

25745193483239113969.Text: Here is your book back, %PCRace. I shall forget this incident with the Nord and commit my life to spreading the wisdom of Vivec. Here, take my possessions. I no longer need them.

5378100243758524.Text: Ah, welcome back, %PCRace! Praise to Vivec five times and five ways. Thank you so much for lending me this book! It has renewed my faith. As you can see, I have renounced my worldly possessions. "I shall neither hoard nor steal, nor encumber myself with profitless treasures, but shall share freely among house and hearth."

1277445542840811834.Text: *Hiccup*... Okay, okay. I was just going anyway. Just let me finish this drink....

2646028729211589912.Text: *Hiccup*... What's that? Who's ... *hiccup*  Who's there?  *hiccup*  Gimme another drink, you cockamamie bastar ... *hiccup*.  Hey ... Hey, this must be about that blasted Wood *hiccup* Elf I just tossed out of here, right?  *hiccup* Hehehehe *hiccup*  Stupid little Wood Elves. Back, *hiccup* back for another round, eh?

1429622655126785090.Text: *Hiccup*... Hey, where's my sujamma? What's taking so long.... Oh. You don't look like the... pulican. Pelican. Publican. That's it. Publican. Get outta my way. HEY? Where's my SUJAMMA?

47451147260824883.Text: Damn that villainous, clay-brained Nord! I hate him! I swear by the teeth of Molag Bal himself I'll have revenge on that corprus-licking ignoramus.

1355224619179417774.Text: I'm not entirely done with the book yet, %PCName. Give me just a bit more time with it.

3272221042790229140.Text: That was a great idea, %PCName. Maybe we can get the bartender to clear him out of here now. Thank you so much. I don't have much to offer, but here, take this money and my ring as a sign of my gratitude.

639124432714313360.Text: Salutations %PCRace! Would you like to look over my wonderful collection of clutter? Perhaps you would even consider helping me fill out my collection.

21090136691617013445.Text: Ah, hello again, %PCName. Feel free to take a look around at my collection.

1910962682869830156.Text: Oh, you again. Come to view my collection and wonder what glory might have been your, eh?

136651368272122489.Text: Salutations, %PCRace. I don't need any more help right now. Are you maybe looking for beds for rent?

32372410319415664.Text: Salutations, %PCRace. Can I help you find something? Looking for beds for rent? Perhaps you'd be interested in helping me with some work I need taken care of?

2996844043239598.Text: Have you taken care of all the problems out there, %PCName?

14351211893018622051.Text: You still haven't taken care of your bouncer duties, %PCRace. I can spot one drunk from here. Head back out and make sure this place is free from troublemakers like that.

119987673925717231.Text: Hello there, %PCRace. Up for a game of shells?

1397925723839622925.Text: Hey, hey, watch it there. *hic*  Why're you harrass...  harrass...  harassin' me? I ain't done nothing to you *hic*. Damn you, you dirty %PCRace. Always . . . *hic* always causing problems.

28144981133578695.Text: %Name welcomes you.  Perhaps you'd like %Name to tell you the latest rumors, yes?

14431106022470617707.Text: Hello again, %PCRace.  Sadly I've been unable to find anyone else willing to help me with repairs, so there will be no bot fights for a while, I fear.

24468326243218324362.Text: Thank you again for saving me, %PCName.

173228473622254.Text: Thank you so much for disabling my haywire bots. I most likely owe you my life. Here, please accept this gold as a reward. I've got some rebuilding to do.

58988360856713064.Text: Help! HELP!!! The bots have all gone crazy! HELP!!!

3111816718151627603.Text: Help me! Help me please! I don't know what happened. My containment gate shattered, and all the bots suddenly started attacking! Disable them for me and I'll pay you well. Look out behind you!

243261230871532267.Text: Ah, welcome back, %PCRace.  Are you ready to help me repair my bots?

8317199462079112665.Text: Thank you for helping me repair my bots, %PCName.

264151128138417.Text: Looks like you got lucky this time, %PCRace. Here is your wager, doubled as promised. Thank you for all your help. Thanks to you, the Robot Arena can continue.

1498210015142729025.Text: Looks like you got lucky this time, %PCRace. Here is your wager, doubled as promised. Thank you for all your help. Thanks to you, the Robot Arena can continue.

750725461547831090.Text: Looks like you got lucky this time, %PCRace. Here is your wager, doubled as promised. Thank you for all your help. Thanks to you, the Robot Arena can continue.

19024155832162832304.Text: Well, I'm sorry %PCName, but I guess you can't win them all. Good luck in all your endeavors, and thank you for helping me repair my bots.

32204122951855129920.Text: Ah, welcome back, %PCRace. Are you ready to help me repair my bots?

31415195542603817616.Text: Not just yet, %PCRace. I need some time to fix my bots. Come back another time.

6864272112827619803.Text: As you can see, I've finally got the bots up and running. The fight is about to start. Would you like to make a friendly wager on the outcome?

15571304281511624287.Text: Hello there, %PCRace. I imagine you've come to see the battles of the Robot Arena. I'm sorry to inform you that there won't be any more battles for some time, unless you think you can help me repair my bots.

26962158881044511537.Text: Greetings, %PCRace.  Have you, by any chance, ever been to the Robot Arena?

17779791863088962.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

13894155161532414548.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

2785024398179993.Text: Dear, dear Thrud. What have I done? I've never found a more faithful friend... and now I shall never hear his voice again. Thank you, %PCName. I owe you my life. But... please... let me be alone with Thrud now.

9030208801922510253.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

7946146263026812863.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

4167187662776728082.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

6461193285678510.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

228941348413771.Text: Thank you, thank you, thank you. Thrud hears that you save his friend Dilborn. Thrud happy, Dilborn happy, ALL happy.

12294154212096227205.Text: Thank you, thank you, thank you. Thrud happy, Dilborn happy, ALL happy.

25742643625771880.Text: You try help Thrud free Dilborn. But Dilborn gone. Thrud sad. Now Thrud got books, but not got Dilborn. Thrud stay here now and pray to book spirits so Dilborn not be lonely.

54772246425414088.Text: Dilborn back! Dilborn back! Dilborn, Thrud says Dilborn never go to sewers again! Here, %PCRace. Take Thrud's favorite book. It is very good... many words... on BOTH sides of pages.

1037716254844014641.Text: Dilborn back! Dilborn back! Dilborn, Thrud says Dilborn never go to sewers again! Here, %PCRace. Take Thrud's favorite book. It is very good... many words... on BOTH sides of pages.

284732764102511926.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. And now, please, I would like to be alone -- to mourn the death of my faithful friend Thrud.

I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

31603156421330222547.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I hope that, under the circumstances, your own virtue will be sufficient reward. I assure you ... I'm everlastingly grateful to be united with my faithful friend Thrud.

23432232442853910539.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I fear that, under the circumstances, your own virtue must be sufficient reward.

1617717951845122952.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I fear that, under the circumstances, your own virtue must be sufficient reward.

2737317508308403330.Text: Thank you, %PCRace. I am in your debt. Alas, in my present financially embarrassed condition, it is a debt I cannot repay. I fear that, under the circumstances, your own virtue must be sufficient reward.

23715209781921030323.Text: You've got your Dilborn. Not how I'd spend my money, frankly, but that's your affair. And now, though it's been charming chatting with you, I won't keep you....

13953219833040625828.Text: The underworld is my world, %PCRace, where we do things my way. This is no place for you. So why don't you go someplace else?

155612332582711606.Text: Oh, you again. Come to rescue your little debt-ridden friend, perhaps? How are you doing down there, Dilborn?  Not so well, eh? Well, that's what happens to people who owe me money and neglect to pay.

1164830007564429796.Text: Well, well, look what the scrib dragged in. I suppose you're here to rescue our little Dilborn, eh? Then I suggest you don't make any sudden moves. You see, when people owe me money, I get a bit touchy. Attack me, and my men have orders to kill Dilborn first -- poor, naked, defenseless Dilborn. But if you're here to settle Dilborn's debts, we may be able to work something out.

1513169501359923535.Text: Hello, nice lady! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.

625617313122546379.Text: Hello, nice man! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.

2206158332429028532.Text: Go sewers now, %PCName. Thrud see Dilborn go there.

58426049285532291.Text: Hello, nice lady! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.

2123121744201841272.Text: Hello, nice man! You see Dilborn? Dilborn my friend! Dilborn gone three days now, and Thrud sad.

20422174533133623742.Text: Thrud not want to talk. Thrud sad. Friend Dilborn gone.

26929738115708685.Text: You don't want to talk to me.  Talk to the boss, Drathas.

1197144171981418176.Text: You don't want to talk to me.  Talk to the boss, Drathas.

19414157371925126727.Text: I'm not selling you any more of my trained beasts. You don't take good enough care of them.

274602822567571992.Text: Greetings and welcome, sera! Are you in the market for trained scribs and rats? I think you'll find my prices quite reasonable, and my rats and scribs are fine as pets or beasts of burden -- or as tasty little morsels.

786690341235214442.Text: You KILLED him! I didn't want him dead! *sob* Get out! GET OUT NOW!

96422233078498379.Text: You killed her! You killed Velyna! It was my wife that paid you to do this, wasn't it?! I'll KILL you!

1097399541851918776.Text: Who are you? What are you doing following me? My wife sent you, didn't she! I knew she was spying on me, and for no good reason, either!
