That woman doesn't take her eye off me, not even for a short trip to the bar.  Well, you can tell that no-good wife of mine that we're through, %PCRace. And don't let me catch you following me ever again.

2936525399445027015.Text: You! Why were you following Taren around?  I saw you, so don't try and deny it. You were sent by his wife, weren't you?  Well, I'll deal with that woman after I deal with you!

30830165073044720920.Text: What are you bothering me for? Please leave me alone.

554714376167924666.Text: Who are you? What are you doing following me? My wife sent you, didn't she! I knew she was spying on me, and for no good reason, either! That woman doesn't take her eye off me, not even for a short trip to the bar. Well, you can tell that no-good wife of mine that we're through, %PCRace. And don't let me catch you following me ever again.

8246167041477719156.Text: Taren is dead?! What were you thinking!? Oh no! *sob* What will I do? I didn't want him dead! *sob* Get out! GET OUT NOW!

2116511053177073068.Text: Welcome, %PCName. Do you have any news? What's that? You caught my husband cheating and killed the woman? Goodness. I should have realized.... But I must admit, you have handled the problem very... efficiently. Here, please accept this money as a reward. I will deal with Taren myself when he gets home.

195616802488225864.Text: All right. If you don't have the time, you don't have the time. Forget about it.

1660621342125629806.Text: Hello again, %PCName. Any news? Did you see my husband?

16268190361649632746.Text: Hello, %PCRace. I don't know what you think you're doing, casually walking into my home like this... I'll thank you to leave... immediately.

29983254454238759.Text: Hello, %PCRace. I don't know what you think you're doing, casually walking into my home like this... I'll thank you to leave... immediately.

1373345371029726275.Text: Hello, %PCRace. I don't know what you think you're doing, casually walking into my home like this... but since you're here... you haven't happened to see my husband around anywhere, have you?

28230295562250617325.Text: Yes, %PCName. You handled things very... neatly. I will deal with Taren myself when he gets home.

20651768382828173.Text: Unfortunately, it seems that someone has killed Gureryne Selvilo, our leading lady, so there won't be any play today. It's never easy, is it?

188815121430313400.Text: I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today.

27651235432354115282.Text: I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today.

387323756654931870.Text: Oh my, yes, I saw what happened, %PCName. I hope you can forgive us, but we knew that an assassin would attack sooner or later.

889314437677430924.Text: Oh my, yes, I saw what happened, %PCName. I hope you can forgive us, but we knew that an assassin would attack sooner or later.

29227109681379513991.Text: Unfortunately, it seems that someone has killed Gureryne Selvilo, our leading lady, so there won't be any play today. It's never easy, is it?

2822525885819324367.Text: You're late, %PCName. I am not pleased with you, but the show must go on. All you have to do is head out there, stand still, and deliver your lines. There's not a whole lot of action in the play, so don't get too caught up in moving around. And be careful, the audience knows the play well, and I'll be counting your mistakes. You've already got one strike for being late. Good luck!

20204326323086925225.Text: Good job, %PCName. You're right on time. Unfortunately, it seems that someone has killed Gureryne Selvilo, our leading lady, so there won't be any play today. It's never easy, is it?

2437984541039226907.Text: Good job, %PCName. You're right on time. Let's get this show on the road. All you have to do is head out there through the door, hit your mark in the center of the rug next to Gureryne, stand still, and deliver your lines. Move quickly through the door -- timing is everything. And be careful, the audience knows the play well, and I'll be counting your mistakes. Break a leg!

1078213161216366102.Text: You're right on time, %PCName. But what have you done with the script? I'll need it back from you before we go any further. Let me know when you've got it.

1004323637108075578.Text: Greetings, %PCRace! I'm Meryn Othralas, founder of the Mournhold Players. I'm sure you came here to watch our production of "The Horror of Castle Xyr." Well, I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today. The troupe has its own drama to worry about at the moment.

225421916442516310.Text: I wonder when the play will start.

6765157213075217520.Text: I wonder when the play will start.

260171352306818764.Text: I wonder when the play will start.

242519956134921974.Text: I wonder if we'll ever find another actor.

1918417098742419298.Text: That wasn't bad... considering the circumstances. You were very brave.

2531354461856713025.Text: I wonder if we'll ever find another actor.

2767252842602931016.Text: Oh, my, what's going on? Why did he attack you? Maybe you should talk to Meryn!

1592629328110568068.Text: Hi %PCRace. You probably want to talk to Meryn backstage. He's in charge of our little troupe here.

773842372604816307.Text: Oh my, yes, I saw what happened, %PCName. I hope you can forgive us, but we knew that an assassin would attack sooner or later.

3235474991994721622.Text: I'm very sorry to inform you that we won't be putting on the show today.

276481510613564158.Text: You have nerve, I must say. But you must be crazy if you think I'll buy artifacts from you that you've stolen from me.

10881297911478221366.Text: Welcome back to the Museum, %PCName.  Are you here to look, or did you wish to sell something?

14013195752834829293.Text: Greetings.  I am Torasa Aram, Curator of the Mournhold Museum of Artifacts.

2440524691302411705.Text: Filthy %PCRace! That note belongs to Ahnia!

23509291942433711542.Text: Ahnia does not know you, so Ahnia has nothing to say to you.

865521483191317779.Text: I'm sorry, %PCName, but I don't think I'll be needing any more of your, ah, 'help'. Excuse me.

16686290282034517056.Text: You don't think I'm actually going to talk to you, do you %PCName?  Don't think I've forgotten what you did.  Now get lost!

31749253212027211739.Text: %PCName, don't you have somewhere....else to be?  You're making me nervous. We can talk tomorrow. Now if you'll excuse me.

30470164849174353.Text: Hello, %PCRace.  No time to talk, I'm afraid.  There's much work to be done. Yes, much to do..  No time for silly fancies, like drinking, dancing... oh, but what I wouldn't give to meet someone new.

29032165251613526796.Text: %PCName! There you are! I wanted to thank you for helping me find Marena Gilnith!

22641128031748513574.Text: Oh, hi %PCName. Listen, thanks for trying to set me up with Marena Gilnith, even though it didn't work out.

27044177962838719049.Text: %PCName! There you are! I wanted to thank you for helping me find Marena Gilnith!

21686881196312631.Text: Hey, look. This really isn't a very good time; I'm right in the middle of my date! Come see me tomorrow after it's over.

19454242091508328676.Text: Sorry, %PCName; I can't talk now. I have to get ready!

3135830759805713660.Text: Confound it, %PCName! Are you determined to make this harder than it is? Leave us alone. I can talk to you some other time.

5206105261070527220.Text: You'll have to come back later on, %PCName. I need time to, ah, prepare for this meeting of yours.

1390398751530823726.Text: Hey, %PCName. I was just thinking about heading over to the bar, since that whole Marena Gilnith thing didn't work out. Nice try on your part, though.

939879761689631433.Text: Hey there, pal! I wanted to thank you for setting me up with Marena Gilnith. It's worked out better than I ever thought it could.

5331265902185616778.Text: Hey there! Listen, I'm right in the middle of putting my charms on her, so why don't you catch up with me tomorrow? That is, if I'm not still busy.  Know what I mean?

1712416247156302956.Text: Hello, %PCName. No time to talk now. Have to get ready for the big date!

254122061577413235.Text: Hey there, friend! Been out cruising the streets? Because I sure have! The women aren't safe when I'm on the town!

2467121059927918346.Text: Back again?  You just can't get enough of me, can you?  Don't worry - it happens to all the women at one time or another.

653427771965712762.Text: Well, hello there.  Aren't you a tasty dish?  You must be new to Mournhold.  I'd have recognized that beautiful face otherwise.  Fons Beren at your service, milady.  A man who loves beautful women.

3239715066205517572.Text: Well met, friend!  You're not a familiar face... new to Mournhold, are you?  Don't suppose you arrived with any female friends, eh?  I get on quite well with the women, you know.

2251420131194729149.Text: Pardon me, friend.  But I'm not feeling very talkative right now.  Perhaps some other time?

85401699629445394.Text: Hi, %PCName! So, did you talk to Marena Gilnith? Did she say anything about me?

200586918112315003.Text: Hi there, %PCName! Are you having as good a time here as I am?

375529897738332027.Text: Hi there.  Wow.  Can you believe this place?  It's just... amazing.  Everything's so beautiful!  The buildings, the shops, the women...  I'm blown away!

13514253082346028041.Text: Well, well, well. Look who it is! My dear friend %PCName. Just my luck that you should stumble in here. Heh. Indeed, it seems my good fortune knows no bounds. Despite my mis-treatment at your hands, I've found riches, been able to influence just about anyone I talk to, and can you believe I've NEVER lost a fight? Never even gotten a scratch. Somehow I don't think I'll have a problem continuing that streak... and I owe you!

282676155385411615.Text: Don't just stand there, %PCName! Get rid of these rats! They've all been infected!

2182431566187409129.Text: Hello, %PCName. Interested in the rumors circulating around the city? I can say that I consider them to be exaggerations of the truth. Several people have fallen ill lately, to be sure, but it is hardly the epidemic people are making it out to be. As long as you're here, however, perhaps I could ask a small favor of you.

2256916867857219921.Text: I wonder if I could trouble you for a moment of your time, %PCName. I don't know if you've heard the rumors going around about a disease; I can say that I consider them to be exaggerations of the truth. Several people have fallen ill lately, to be sure, but it is hardly the epidemic people are making it out to be. Regardless, I wondered if I could ask a small favor of you.

267061779065875668.Text: Nothing to worry yourself about, citizen. Just some crazy woman. Move it along.

3781124101999513107.Text: %PCName! You've got to do something! I stepped out for a bit of fresh air, only to hear the door lock behind me! There was some horrible screaming a few minutes ago, but it's gone all quiet now, and no one has answered when I've pounded on the door. We've got to get in there!

57793242322936994.Text: It's safe... too heavy to open. Water will get me past though... just turn the crank....

157129473145973190.Text: I can sneak past.... red eyes won't see me... won't hurt me...

2503632720735818187.Text: I'll be safe down there.... thieves won't find it... won't find me...

68721021247410188.Text: I'm sorry you had to see that. She's been like this for months now, and no one can seem to get through to her. We have no idea what "it" is, or why she's become so paranoid about it. Any attempts to discuss the matter with her have ended badly. Some even violently. That's why we bring a guard with us when we visit. As a friend of the family, I can't just leave her to her own devices. I've heard, however, that she was seen talking to Elbert Nermarc recently. Perhaps he might know more.

214552522318496910.Text: I think you should speak with Golena Sadri before I say anything. It.... well, it will be clearer to you that way.

30739236861568771.Text: I know you.... you're one of THEM! You can't fool me! Well, you'll never get your hands on it! It's safe from the likes of you! From all you thieves! There's nothing for you here; just get out. GET OUT!

623939681339114545.Text: No, no. No way out. One way in. It's safe. No one can find it.

2003325200122538095.Text: I do hope there's something you can do to help poor Golena. There's simply no reason for this madness!

17363134462692315040.Text: Greetings, I am Tadera Andules. Are you an acquaintance of Golena Sadri? If so, perhaps you'll have better luck talking to her than we have...

680443572345729209.Text: No offense, but I don't have anything else to say to you. Don't want to get into any more trouble than I already am. You'd better go.

1900165592037010478.Text: Funny how this all turned out, isn't it? Never thought I'd end up here. Well, at least we're safe from Dovor. He got in the way when we tried to leave, so I had to take him down. I'm better off this way. At least, I think so...  Oh, and your name never came up. I talked to Felvan ahead of time, and made sure of that. So, I guess it's all over.

4017256573082128197.Text: Dovor! NO! I'll skin you alive, %PCRace!

13193284342903821433.Text: Look, there's nothing to say. Might as well just leave me alone.

824819698171723626.Text: Well, we did it. Turned ourselves in. Yup. And we didn't say anything about you, so you're not in trouble or nothing. *sigh* Dovor didn't like it, and he got mad. Olvyne hit him real hard, and we ran when he fell down. I hope his head doesn't hurt too bad. Oh, well. I guess there's nothing left to say.

3254615741966413557.Text: You....you killed Dovor! I'll get you!

2130128171655132254.Text: Shunari has thanked brave %PCName for helping, and for killing evil Gedna Relvel. But now Shunari must go.

27156257151571815725.Text: Ahh. Shunari feels much better. And now Shunari will tell %PCName all about Gedna Relvel.

292288362546115645.Text: Good %PCName has returned! Is %PCName here to help Shunari?

3227221370187757858.Text: Why has %PCName killed guard? Now Shunari will be blamed! Shunari only meant to knock guard out, not kill him!

2942630923786310229.Text: Please hurry. Shunari is weak, and needs to be cured. She cannot go upstairs, or else guards will see her and take her to prison. Shunari is not safe here, and will meet %PCName in Temple Gardens instead.

88202667985956821.Text: Shunari must speak with %PCName! She has seen things, oh yes, things that %PCName needs to know! Quickly, before guard wakes up!

13832249493091426763.Text: You again! Gah! I've rid myself of the others; none of you will get it! It's mine, I tell you, all mine!

2623414147306826803.Text: OW! Vicious thug! I'll get you! I'll..... I'm getting out of here!

1011613061182015347.Text: I won't forget you. Get out of my sight!

2546421477215821626.Text: Oh, it's YOU. What, have you come to run me completely out of business?

1325274161107022739.Text: Welcome, %PCRace, welcome! The best deals in all of Mournhold can be found here. Low prices every day, and special offers as well! Please, take your time and look through my wares.

20045143511168923805.Text: No time to talk, %PCRace. Excuse me.

151882440380377295.Text: Hello, %PCName.  Is this about the Estate Sale again?

4086328576528276.Text: Hello, %PCName.  I hope the dagger has been of use to you, or has been some comfort in Sandas' absence.

196906836247523550.Text: Oh, hello there.  I'm terribly busy right now, trying to get everything organized for the Estate Sale.

6405280792267125136.Text: I'll have nothing further to do with you, %PCRace. You are a liar, and most likely a thief as well. Now remove yourself from my home, lest I summon the guards to deal with you!

165969202552732543.Text: Yes? Is this about the Estate Sale? I'm not quite ready for it yet, you see.

13668216272152022707.Text: Hello.  If you're here about the Estate Sale, I'm afraid a date hasn't been set yet.

2000219729964814346.Text: It seems you're the only one with any reason around here, %PCName.

27518614418512416.Text: They won't let me in! I'm sick man, and the bastards WON'T LET ME IN!

25553166942428129646.Text: So. She has sent you for me. Now YOU are Her favorite. How convenient. Whichever of us dies... she will be well pleased. And if both of us die, so much the better. Well, I am content. Perhaps this is how it was meant to end. I ask the forgiveness of all the gods and spirits -- whoever they may be. And you, too, might make your peace with your gods, because at least one of us will not live to see another sunset.

323961726115479461.Text: I do not want company. Go away.

19649248241976116504.Text: I'm true to my word. I said I would not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. That's what you wanted, and that's what you've got. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do....

291456248502724942.Text: I said you could go. So go. But I warn you -- don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do....

17812196554948118.Text: Well. I must say, you've done your research. You've located Granny Varis and Gee-Pop Varis. I value truth -- but I value the lives of my parents more highly. Very well. I will not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. You have my word. And now, if you'll excuse me, we'll have to relocate immediately, now that the secret of our office is spoiled.

30841014740584945.Text: Hmm. You are a shrewd judge of character. I am a man of principle, and will not hold my common tongue for a payment of gold. But I know what benefits gold can do if it is used in a good cause. Very well. I will not discuss King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. You have my word. And I'll take your 3000 gold, and will contribute it to the Widows and Orphans Fund. And now, if you'll excuse me, we'll have to relocate immediately, now that the secret of our office is spoiled.

2792309682228810126.Text: And you don't HAVE 3000 gold right now? I suppose you plan to get it to me 'right away'? Why don't I trust you? Well, thank you for your generous offer, but I'm afraid not. The only way to be sure of preserving our secret is to seal your lips -- permanently. I regret the loss of life -- but it is the risk you run when you break into someone's secret office.

19890211771405224634.Text: You are not a very good judge of character. I am a man of principle, and will not hold my common tongue for a payment of gold. And of course if I kill you first, I preserve the secret of my hidden office. The choice is easy.

2422207641853619720.Text: Of course you're right. And of course if I kill you first, I preserve the secret of my hidden office. The choice is easy.

707042382277230530.Text: I know you by reputation, %PCName. You've done some remarkable things. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

30435174891710219995.Text: I'm afraid not. The only way to be sure of preserving our secret is to seal your lips -- permanently. I regret the loss of life -- but it is the risk you run when you break into someone's secret office.

2458884461596521935.Text: 'Honest.' So you expect me to trust you? My experiences with trusting adventurers like you have been disappointing in the past. But... this time, you may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.

14676123701088116370.Text: Congratulations. You have produced an original and entertaining excuse. Completely unbelievable, of course, but none the worse for that. Never heard a believable excuse before, anyway. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

2315923915134284806.Text: Congratulations. You have produced an original and entertaining excuse. Completely unbelievable, of course, but none the worse for that. Never heard a believable excuse before, anyway. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.

6001164161471522431.Text: I see. You've made a serious mistake. I don't approve of your trade -- but I understand that a desperate person -- or imprudently greedy person -- may turn his hand to crime without being truly evil. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Oh, well. Since our offices are no longer secret, we'll have to relocate immediately. But don't touch anything here, and don't interfere with myself or my colleagues, or you will not leave here alive.

284255034812812563.Text: I see. You've made a serious mistake. I don't approve of your trade -- but I understand that a desperate person -- or imprudently greedy person -- may turn his hand to crime without being truly evil. Very well. You may go. I'd like to preserve our secret office... but I won't kill you to do it. Just go... and keep your mouth shut.

9784103632086223016.Text: I haven't printed lies about King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. I've only printed the truth. And I intend to keep on printing the truth in 'The Common Tongue' -- unless you think you can stop me.
Script: Choice "I think killing you will stop you." 5 "I think a gift of 1000 gold will stop you." 6 "I think a donation of 3000 gold to the Widows and Orphans Fund will stop you." 7 "I think threatening your aged parents will stop you." 8

1430791661045525159.Text: I haven't printed lies about King Helseth in 'The Common Tongue'. I've only printed the truth. And I intend to keep on printing the truth in 'The Common Tongue' -- unless you think you can stop me.
Script: Choice "I think killing you will stop you." 5 "I think a gift of 1000 gold will stop you." 6 "I think a donation of 3000 gold to the Widows and Orphans Fund will stop you." 7

22959208171161821005.Text: What are you doing here? And may I suggest you make your answer very clear, because this office and what we do here is a well-kept-secret. And we wish to keep it a secret, even if it means that you do not leave her alive.
Script: Choice "You will stop printing lies about King Helseth." 1 "Excuse me. I'm just an honest working burglar, and I want no trouble." 2 "I'm looking for the Eye of Argonia." 3 "My mistake. I'll leave, and keep your secret. Honest." 4

3234248923247631074.Text: What are you doing here? And may I suggest you make your answer very clear, because this office and what we do here is a well-kept-secret. And we wish to keep it a secret, even if it means that you do not leave her alive.
Script: Choice "Excuse me. I'm just an honest working burglar, and I want no trouble." 2 "I'm looking for the Eye of Argonia." 3 "My mistake. I'll leave. Honest." 4

2376110497185194165.Text: All the trees and plants, tended lawns and paths, are hymns of praise to Almalexia's name. It's humble work, sera, but I'm very proud of it.

1087525036370929170.Text: This temple is clean as Almalexia's conscience, sera. And mind you keep it that way.

26112136631386124671.Text: Talk to the boss. I'm just hired help.

39401802649897424.Text: Don't talk to me. Talk to the boss. We just work here. But don't try anything funny, or we'll settle with you the hard way.

3126519838563023371.Text: I have nothing to say. You want to talk, talk to Varis.

4010315402625030808.Text: Hello there.  I suppose you've come to trade, and that's fine with me.  Azura knows there's little else in the world worth doing.  None of the rest of it matters...  adventuring, fame, women.  It's all pointless.

29995202412433911250.Text: If you're here to offer your respects, speak to Ravani Llethan, the king's widow.

17873100002161121481.Text: If you're here to offer your respects, speak to Ravani Llethan, the king's widow.

2301911551723727400.Text: Thank you for visiting with me in my time of grief.

2785628878244813350.Text: Leave me alone with my grief.

1638352812712823661.Text: But... I don't understand. Is something the matter?

8727270421565426951.Text: I am Forven Berano. But I don't see how that matters to you.

7363080922429670.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

25821258491375217.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

2145024501310819849.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

2165525376319625258.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

25382218042027022858.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

1181181399367923.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

66961581102136365.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

2064152171881118881.Text: Your killing of one of my Royal Guards is a matter to be resolved according to the law. But regardless of the law, I refuse to have anything further to do with you.

621213521571122808.Text: There are no more official matters to discuss. You are to report directly to the King himself.

17165130272509324906.Text: I sent you to investigate the disturbance, and you reported your findings to Hler. Disappointing. I have no more official matters to discuss with you, but His Royal Highness King Hlaalu Helseth wishes to speak with you.

228133901226988288.Text: Well, have you been able to investigate the disturbance?

127023503205033708.Text: I understand you've reported this attack on the city to Fedris Hler. I agree you should investigate the disturbance in the ruins of Bamz-Amschend and seek out the source of the attacks. You may report your findings to me. This is really a matter for the Empire to deal with.

3096117003171108600.Text: I have heard about the attack on the city, and I've dispatched guards to take care of it. Thank you for your report. You can help in another way. I'd like you to investigate the disturbance.

17629275802324325528.Text: I'm the captain of King Helseth's Royal Guards. Is this an official matter? Or is there something else you want?

1660732249308423536.Text: Yes, %PCName. Is this an official matter? Or is there something else you want?

478513606304304056.Text: [He looks you over slowly and deliberately.] Excuse me.

234816037106222636.Text: [He seems amused, but determined not to speak to you.] I said... EXCUSE ME.

938615211189369990.Text: If you have heard the latest rumors, perhaps someone of your abilities and experience could find it in your heart to help the community.

909603835888685.Text: Give to the Temple, and receive the blessings of Almalexia.

5151192022486220489.Text: I have delivered my message. Now I can be at peace.

10211196672491415240.Text: Stranger! Listen! I have a message I must tell you!

3133810475316110755.Text: You killed Variner's Ghost? How could you? Now I will never know what message he might have given me!

30716727199044607.Text: Thank you, %PCName. It can't console me for my loss, but you have set Variner Areloth's spirit to rest.

2005741273034617.Text: Beware the Black Dart gang, adventurer. They've robbed me of everything I hold dear.

585557751143818945.Text: Forget it. I'll never work for you again.

19869301891018129749.Text: I quit! I warned you! I told you I work for profit, and I won't be robbed! I'll never work for you again!

214986995353229505.Text: I'm badly wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

25248325051053517501.Text: I'm wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

28999358832241440.Text: I like a little workout, %PCName. But I'm wounded, and you want to keep me at full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

8418506232049216.Text: What do you need, %PCName? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

2520446032464019980.Text: Hello again, %PCName. As you can see, I'm once again available for hire.

191356991136216579.Text: I'm badly wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

10311199072737823615.Text: I'm wounded. Heal me, or let's get some  rest so I can get back to full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

230242150963587221.Text: I like a little workout, %PCName. But I'm wounded, and you want to keep me at full health. Is there anything else on your mind? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

2175814116374024486.Text: What do you need, %PCName? Do you want to change the plan? Or were you thinking you'd like to improve my effectiveness?

105162463040891632.Text: If you're looking for someone to watch your back, I'm available for hire.

2049427553020924304.Text: Can't talk now, %PCRace.  I'm waiting for someone.

27176376136947382.Text: I'm sorry, but I'm very busy.  I don't have time to talk.

21840139682906620446.Text: Hey, %PCName.  I saw you talking to Felvan.  The two of you looked pretty cozy.  What's going on?  You're not scared or something, are you?

28322600298415826.Text: Look %PCName, our business is done.  We don't really have a reason to keep talking.  So if you have something to say, say it to Dovor.

46851215124814314.Text: So?  Did you find Bels Uvenim?

3024419079315415033.Text: Dovor said to see me?  Well, err, he said... I mean, there's this guy, and I'm supposed to ask for.. I mean, I want his stuff, right?  Dovor says you can get it.  I don't want to know anything more than that. Go find Bels Uvenim and get his spear and his helmet. He's probably hanging around the Temple. That's it.

318912865250648.Text: Look, I'm not in charge.  Talk to Dovor, okay?

173841378573252363.Text: We're friends, right?  Well, just between friends, I'm a little bit scared.

1118322427322498162.Text: Hi again, %PCName. I don't think there's anything else I'm supposed to say to you. So I guess you'd better go talk to Dovor.

2067017648100912731.Text: Oh, hey. You were doing something for me, right? Oh yeah. That. Have you found Elanande yet?

1289077481946617887.Text: Dovor said to talk to me?  Oh..  Umm...  well, if he thinks I should get some new stuff, then maybe I should.  I know that Elanande has some real nice equipment.  I like that robe of hers, and one time I saw the axe she has.  Looks really pretty.  Hmm.  Dovor said she doesn't deserve them, and that they'd be better for me than her.  Dovor's always right, you know.

26066185862886016529.Text: Dovor is in charge.  You'd better talk to him.

155006922310027136.Text: You kill my companions, and expect civil conversation? You scum!

93371456281220386.Text: You kill my companions, and expect civil conversation? You scum!

2294628710255325013.Text: I told you not to come back, didn't I?  I'm afraid I can't tolerate this disrespect, %PCName.

2833630355580917975.Text: Hello, %PCName.  I see you've accomodated Olvyne's wishes.  Nicely done.  Now, if you could assist us one last time, we'd be most thankful.

26740226481166614139.Text: Well then, %PCName.  You were able to get what Felvan needed?  Excellent.  You're certainly welcome to continue to assist us, if you wish.

681125170658525186.Text: Ah, %PCName.  Our comrade in arms, our ally in the fight for freedom!

2848431203151667723.Text: You've no business being here, %PCRace.  I suggest you turn around, go out the way you came in, and forget you ever saw us.

105636038112287363.Text: This weather is odd, but nothing to be concerned about. Go about your business.

17547275752142424924.Text: This weather is odd, but nothing to be concerned about. Go about your business.

27351209512701919961.Text: This weather will pass. The goddess will protect us. Move along.

2577222913202210381.Text: Ashstorms here in Mournhold! Why has Almalexia not done anything about this? She must make it end!

10063813220949749.Text: Ashstorms here in Mournhold! Surely the goddess will protect us from this!

2961311794199375738.Text: This weather is awful! I don't know how the Bazaar is staying open!

5418272701652517024.Text: I can't believe these ashstorms! I've heard of them on the island, but not here in Mournhold! How can this be?

2663180281283126347.Text: Ashstorms here in the city? How can this happen? This isn't Vvardenfell! Something must be done quickly!

2417169329411623.Text: These storms are odd, but it will pass. There is no cause for alarm.

26537241831909521983.Text: I'm certain this weather will clear up soon. There is no reason to panic.

5586317502191119848.Text: I'm certain this weather will clear up soon. There is no reason to panic.

1738014989227111870.Text: This weather is unbelievable. What can it mean? This isn't supposed to happen here! Not again!

2541048941629420333.Text: I can't believe these ashstorms! I've heard of them on the island, but not here in Mournhold! Why does this keep happening?

2056622339295626215.Text: Well, look who it is. Have I got a bone to pick with you, %PCName.

2052631290579026467.Text: Well, look who it is. Have I got a bone to pick with you, %PCName.

5476249922691017712.Text: Well, look who it is. Have I got a bone to pick with you, %PCName.

28582176731012917873.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Fons Beren!

1447589373010017113.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Sunel Hlas!

87881062328495177.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Goval Ralen!

2700564692428125719.Text: There you are, %PCName! I have to thank you for helping me find Goval Ralen!

3226200521258421632.Text: Hello again, %PCName. The arrangements have been made, I take it?

28540148052848512004.Text: Hello there, %PCName! Any luck helping me meet someone new?

8854321772821820559.Text: Hello there, %PCRace! Before you take another step, allow me to introduce myself. My name is Gaenor, and I'm... well, I'm an entrepreneur of sorts. I was wondering if I could ask a small favor of you.

13568231434823734.Text: Weakling! You dare to cross my threshold? You, then, will be the first to fall, before the undead army sweeps across this land like a plague, cleansing it of your flesh.  Die, mortal!

310941559979747883.Text: The winds have whispered to me, %PCName. They have told me of your failure to enter Hrothmund's Barrow. In order to become chieftain of Thirsk, you needed to enter the barrow and grasp the axe of Hrothmund to receive his blessing. Now, that will never happen. This is a sad day. I fear Thirsk will never reopen.

390119807270132179.Text: You...you mean to tell me you found the entrance to...to Hrothmund's Barrow...and...and uttered the WRONG name? You...you idiot! Get away from me.... You...you're obviously completely incompetent!

29730187151442596.Text: All hail %PCName, the chieftain of Thirsk! What can I do for you, my lord. Perhaps there is some mead hall business you'd like to tend to? Or maybe you'd rather just go upstairs and rest in your quarters?

21781291132615826803.Text: Have you met my love, Brandr?

1655560447774481.Text: You've killed her! You've killed the only woman I've ever loved! Now you will pay!

3370183822863118880.Text: Let me introduce you to Erna. She and I have a love my wife would never understand.

30285135411208018450.Text: All hail the new sheeftain of Thirshk! *burp!* Becaushe of you, the mead hall ish open again! Here'sh to your health! *burp!*

533715946135262563.Text: [Bathmar plays his lute and sings the praises of the new chieftain of Thirsk] In the cave she met the beast, and cut quite short its evil feast! And when the Udyrfrykte did fall, the chieftain came and claimed her hall! The danger gone the mead did flow, and everyone at Thirsk did know, that %PCName would rule great Thirsk until the end of time!

157609341293655531.Text: [Bathmar plays his lute and sings the praises of the new chieftain of Thirsk] In the cave he met the beast, and cut quite short its evil feast! And when the Udyrfrykte did fall, the chieftain came and claimed his hall! The danger gone the mead did flow, and everyone at Thirsk did know, that %PCName would rule great Thirsk until the end of time!

163424400799473.Text: So, you travel the wilds of Solstheim, just as I do? Here's a word of advice from one wanderer to another -- keep your eyes open and your wits about you. There's more than bears and wolves roaming about this island. If you find yourself face to face with the berserkers or fryse hags, sheathe your blade and get to running! If you need shelter, my kinsfolk at Thirsk will gladly take you in.

188192166558639640.Text: Oh.  I see.  I thought I sensed honor in you, %PCName.  It is why I offered you this chance at glory.  Perhaps I was wrong about you....  If you have a change of heart, return to me and we will fight valiantly to the death.  And don't worry. I'm not going to ambush you.  In order to enter Sovngarde I must die in valiant combat.  I will not lower myself to cowardice and deceit as Grimkell did.  Now leave me, %PCName.  I have much to consider.

1694527631140626804.Text: Need to get back to Fort Frostmoth? Wouldn't you rather take a boat than walk? My price is reasonable.

161327371335131073.Text: You honor me with this decision!  Songs will be written of our glorious battle!  It is true that in my heart I wish to be defeated, so that I may enter Sovngarde.  But know, this %PCName.  I will fight, and fight valiantly, as I have all my life.  You will probably die by my hand.  I will grant no quarter, no mercy, and I expect no less from you.  Go now. Prepare for battle.  When you are ready, speak with me again, and then we shall engage in armed combat!

1527335051386222389.Text: New theories, you say?  Let me see the book you speak of.  Hmmm.... Could this be?  Is it possible the entrance to Sovngarde lie right before me all along?  It makes so much sense!  %PCName, you've done it!  You've found the way to Sovngarde!  All I need to do is die valiantly in combat!  But how....  I know!  You, %PCName!  You must help me!  You must defeat me in armed combat and send my soul to Sovngarde!  Tell me, will you honor me with a fight to the death?
Script: Choice "Sorry, Ulfgar, I can't help you." 2 "I'll help you, Ulfgar.  I will do everything in my power to defeat you in armed combat." 3

344221785967817277.Text: Ah, a visitor.  And an Elf, no less.  In my youth I would have hewn you like an oak, and bathed in your invader blood.  But that was a long time ago, and the years have mellowed my mood.  In any event, it's been quite a while since I've had any company.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

150548772286511012.Text: Ah, a visitor.  And an Elf, no less.  In my youth I would have hewn you like an oak, and bathed in your invader blood.  But that was a long time ago, and the years have mellowed my mood.  In any event, it's been quite a while since I've had any company.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

135928321753918528.Text: Welcome back, %PCName.  I hope Solstheim has been treating you well.  So tell me...have you managed to locate the entrance to Sovngarde?  Ha!  Of course you haven't!  I searched for five hundred years and never succeeded!  You know, there's a part of me that feels Sovngarde doesn't even exist....

22365238581846021667.Text: Ah, a visitor.  And an Elf, no less.  In my youth I would have hewn you like an oak, and bathed in your invader blood.  But that was a long time ago, and the years have mellowed my mood.  In any event, it's been quite a while since I've had any company.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

1680795301035110486.Text: *cough!*  %PCName...  *gasp!*  You...you did it...  You defeated me!  *gasp!*  You have... *cough*  opened the gates to...to Sovngarde!  *gasp!*  I...I can see them before me....  My brothers...my brothers are there!  *cough!*  I must go now, my friend.  *cough!*  Go...go to Brodir Grove.  If I can... *gasp!*  ...I will return to you there.  I will.... *gasp!*  ...reward you for...for everything!  Must go...now... *cough!*  I'm coming, my comrades! *cough!*  I'm cccooo..... *gasp!*

2259126300285733451.Text: Ah, a visitor.  It's been quite a while since I've had any company, friend.  I'm afraid I don't have much to offer a guest...unless, of course, you've come to hear a barbarian's sad tale.

26665154423101328751.Text: %PCName, I...I wasn't sure you'd return.  Tell me...have you come to accept my offer, and engage me in a fight to the death?
Script: Choice "Sorry, Ulfgar, I can't help you." 2 "I'll help you, Ulfgar.  I will do everything in my power to defeat you in armed combat." 3

18734306931781631090.Text: Welcome back, %PCName.  I hope Solstheim has been treating you well.  So tell me...have you managed to locate the entrance to Sovngarde?  Ha!  Of course you haven't!  I searched for five hundred years and never succeeded!  You know, there's a part of me that feels Sovngarde doesn't even exist....
Script: Choice "Actually, Ulfgar, I came upon this book.  It's called 'Sovngarde, a Reexamination,' and seems to offer new theories on how one may enter Sovngarde.  I think it may have the answers you seek." 1

32279320191818624922.Text: I have been waiting for you, %PCName.  The hour of battle is upon us.  I hope you are well prepared to engage such a worthy foe as myself.  I have roamed the land for five hundred years, leaving death in my wake.  And although I have been brought to the brink of death on more than one occasion, still I live.  It is my hope, %PCName, that you are my match, and will send my soul racing to Sovngarde.  Now, we test our mettle!  To arms!

295458120132598183.Text: Hail, %PCClass. Svenja Snow-Song is my name. We welcome guests here at Thirsk, so long as they behave themselves. Respect my home and my clan, and we'll get along just fine. Normally I'd tell outsiders to stay clear of Erich the Unworthy, but I see that won't be necessary now, will it?

28648310991695427202.Text: Good to see you again, %PCName.  I hope our fair island is treating you well enough.

1839223478147927393.Text: Lead on, %PCName.  The undead beast roams the halls of the Valbrandr Barrow.

2837032763102489091.Text: Hello, %PCName.  I was just going over my notes.  I'm here on Solstheim doing some research, you see.

100629519639132034.Text: Hello, dear %PCName. It is so cold outside! Come in and warm yourself. Maybe a nap would help restore your strength?

1151425812429914221.Text: %PCName, you have returned. I'd ask if you have extracted wergild from Sigvatr the Strong, but I know that is too much to hope for.

1079617541206208085.Text: I'm sorry, %PCName, but I'm not in the best of spirits. As you know, my Gustav was murdered and I seek wergild as compensation for his death.

668019621477231887.Text: Please leave me be, %PCRace.  I don't mean to be rude, but I've suffered the loss of my son, and don't want company right now.

15915300003183010736.Text: You again.  What do you want?

206101264854313088.Text: Ask your questions but be quick, %PCClass.  I'm quite busy with the moon sugar investigation.

256922811483319128.Text: %PCName, you've returned.  The fact that you're not carrying a white Colovian fur helm leads me to believe that the moon sugar poisoner is still at large.  Please hurry.  If one more person is victimized by this scoundrel, it could mean my job.  And that would make me most unhappy.

2003897792670714558.Text: %PCName!  Do my eyes deceive me, or is that a white Colovian fur helm?  Then the deed is done.  The moon sugar poisoner has been brought to justice.  Excellent work.  The Imperial Legion will not forget you, or your assistance.  Here, please take this gold as a symbol of our thanks.

1501345822922628521.Text: %PCName!  Do my eyes deceive me, or is that a white Colovian fur helm?  Then the deed is done.  The moon sugar poisoner has been brought to justice.  Excellent work.  You have done a great service to me, the Legion, and the Empire itself.  Take this gold as payment for a job well done.  And I would also give you another reward, as a symbol of my personal thanks. This shortsword has served me well, and you'll find its enchantments will help rally others to your cause.

2445479772580726818.Text: Hail, %PCName!  How can I help you, my brother-in-arms?

1333122841121358034.Text: Hail, %PCName!  How can I help you, my sister-in-arms?

21396186252054210443.Text: Hail, %PCName!  How can I help you, my friend?

4765168922094917297.Text: He he!  Ha ha!  Can it be?  A visitor in my workshop?  How can I help you, sweet %PCName?  I have candy treats to spare, if you come in search of happiness!

1690193581709411949.Text: Ha ha!  What's this?  Why it's little %PCName, come to pay Uncle Sweetshare a visit!  I've been a good boy, %PCName!  I promise!  He he he he he!

4801226782722811515.Text: %PCName!  You did it!  By helping me die valiantly you showed my soul the way to Sovngarde!  My friends -- Hunroor, Erlendr, and Nikulas -- have been waiting for me.  I told them of your willingness to help me, and recounted our glorious battle!  The four of us wish to give you a reward fitting of such a warrior.  So, we give you a piece of ourselves.  Lay your hands on a stone, and you will receive that warrior's greatest attribute!  Now farewell, my friend!  Sovngarde awaits!

1658620670271717558.Text: Hello, stranger. I don't see many sightseers out here. The cold and horkers drive most people away. Me, I just come here to watch the sea. I used to be a ship captain, you know. But that was before...before that night at sea.

807323101897612515.Text: I'm sorry, but I'm not in the mood for visitors right now.  Just look at this mess, %PCCLass.  Do you see what that foul draugr has done?  He has ruined my dwelling and stolen away my only friend.

258111761439912288.Text: %PCClass, you've returned!  Oh, I see you haven't found Oddfrid White-Lip.  I do hope the draugrs haven't proved too much for you.  My nights are especially lonely without Oddfrid's sweet voice to keep me company.  You should hear her joke about the Khajiit fishmonger...now THAT'S a good one!  Anyway, when you rescue Oddfrid, please return to me.  Now, as you can see, my dwelling is still in shambles, and there's a lot of cleaning left to do.  Goodbye.

20888149043190219153.Text: %PCClass, you've returned!  And you've found Oddfrid!  Yes, I know...Oddfrid is a skull.  She was a skull when I first found her, but she does talk to me.  I hear her voice inside my head.  I would have told you the truth, but I didn't want you to think I was crazy.  So tell me, %PCName -- do you want me to tell your future?  Or perhaps I should first remove Thormoor's curse of eternal wakefulness?

122091097725907012.Text: So, Kolfinna is seeking wergild for the death of her husband, eh?  Never!  Pinetear has been in my family for generations and will be for generations to come.  Besides, Gustav got what he had coming.

2972160951698730002.Text: Leave me, %PCName. I'm am busy watching the mighty sea, waiting to die.

3216815506253812603.Text: %PCName, you have returned. What is this you say? Geilir the Mumbling is dead? No...no.... With his death, my curse will never be lifted. Once all I had was hope -- now even that is lost. Leave me. I will remain on this rock until the end of my days. For what else can I do?

2015017362690827579.Text: Hello, %PCName. I have to admit, I didn't expect to see you again. The fact that I'm still exhausted but am unable to sleep tells me you were unable to convince Geilir the Mumbling to remove my curse of eternal wakefulness. Maybe someday I'll be able to rest. Someday....

1109845383214225158.Text: %PCName! You did it! You spoke with Geilir, got him to remove his curse! I know this because I can barely stay on my feet! I'm ready to fall asleep, my friend! Do you hear me? Fall asleep! Ha ha! I need to lie down.... %PCName, you have done me an incredible service, and I would like to return the favor. But not just yet. First, I must sleep. Meet me in my room at the Thirsk mead hall, and I will give you your due, after I've had a chance to get some rest.

909729990247199608.Text: Please, %PCName, let me go and rest. Meet me at Thirsk and I will give you your reward then, after I have had time to sleep.

2467914181324123642.Text: %PCName! I've had some time to rest, and am ready to grant your reward. As a sea captain, I discovered many hidden places, one of which is an ancient barrow called Gyldenhul. It lies on a small island off the northeast coast of Solstheim, not too far from here, actually. The barrow is loaded with riches, and I want you to have it all. Take this key -- the door is heavily locked. Oh, and I'll mark the dungeon on your map. Now, I must get back to sleep.  Thanks again!
Script: MessageBox "Thormoor has marked Glydenhul on your map."

167792915294775427.Text: Hello, my friend. *Yawn!*  I hope you're doing well. If you haven't already, make sure you go to Gyldenhul and collect its riches. Me, I'm going to get some more sleep.

658515013115730357.Text: %PCClass, you've returned!  And you've found Oddfrid!  Yes, I know...Oddfrid is a skull.  She was a skull when I first found her, but she does talk to me.  I hear her voice inside my head.  I would have told you the truth, but I didn't want you to think I was crazy.  So tell me, %PCName -- do you want me to tell your future?

15195462297632652.Text: Hello again, %PCClass.  It seems we still have some unfinished business.  If I'm not mistaken, there's something you want from me.

16939212962968123637.Text: Hello again, %PCClass.  It seems we still have some unfinished business.  If I'm not mistaken, there's something you want from me.

2864854762993030049.Text: Hail, traveler.  I'd tell you about my wares, but by now you're probably well aware of my craftsmanship.  My weapons are unmatched, and I make a lot of the fine bear and wolf armor that many of Solstheim's Nords are so fond of.  I must admit, though, I'm growing weary of patching together the same old wolf and bear pelts.  In truth, I long to test my abilities and make some custom fur armor, using the pelts of Solstheim's more exotic animals.

1145678002639923126.Text: Greetings, %PCName.  My name is Bereditte Jastal.  Perhaps you'd like to buy one of my books?  I'm a bookseller by trade, but my real passion is writing.  I recently finished two scholarly works, Thirsk, a History and Sovngarde, a Reexamination.  I have copies of both for sale, among others.

28379122511349819353.Text: Hail, %PCClass. Svenja Snow-Song is my name. We welcome guests here at Thirsk, so long as they behave themselves. Respect my home and my clan, and we'll get along just fine. One word of advice, though -- stay clear of Erich the Unworthy. He's more trouble than he's worth.

3276191812384925826.Text: He...he came to the mead hall and killed...killed everyone he could!  There was no warning! My clan fought bravely, but they were no match. I rained arrows upon the beast, and finally drove him off. But he'll be back!  It all happened so quickly. We were just standing here, enjoying our mead and the warmth of the fire, when he struck. Never have I seen a creature so savage. If I didn't know better, I'd say the monster that did this was the Udyrfrykte, but how could that be?

17737234017289989.Text: My goodness, is everything all right downstairs? I heard screaming, and the sounds of battle!  I would have gone down to investigate, but I'm much more of an observer than a participant, if you get my meaning.  I'm a bookseller by trade, but my real passion is writing.  The Solstheim Nords are my area of expertise, you might say. I recently finished two scholarly works -- Thirsk, a History and Sovngarde, a Reexamination.  I have copies of both for sale, among others.

364625860607322551.Text: Hello, my friend. *Yawn!*  I hope you're doing well. If you haven't already, make sure you go to Gyldenhul and collect its riches. Me, I'm going to get some more sleep. I'll try, anyway. Not easy with all the screaming and banging going on downstairs! My kinsfolk do love their ale!

3235133512376310087.Text: Why have you returned, %PCClass?  Have you finally accepted that the beast must be stopped, and it is your destiny to do so?

45853406240032362.Text: I'm sorry, %PCClass, but none may enter the mead hall while.... You...you hold the Heart of the Udyrfrykte!  Can this be?  You have slain the fell beast?  By the gods, you truly are a warrior worthy of song!  Give the heart to me, then. I will make ready the mead hall, and when the debris of battle has been cleared the Heart of the Udyrfryte will be placed on the pedestal of Thirsk.  There is but one more task you must complete before being named chieftain.

22619176112669910646.Text: Hail, %PCClass!  You say you have slain the Uderfrykte?  I wish to believe you, but what have you claimed as a battle trophy?  I need to see some part of the beast as proof of your victory.  Bring me the heart!  Yes, the heart of that foul beast will show all of Solstheim that the ancient evil lives and breathes no longer.

129751035215718132.Text: I have the Heart of the Udyrfrykte, %PCClass, and will place it on the pedestal of Thirsk as soon as the mead hall has been repaired.  But you have not yet received the blessing of Hrothmund the Red.  I know this, for the chill air whispers to me.  It speaks to me of sorrow and death.  If Hrothmund chooses to bless you, I will sense it in the wind.  I will know there is hope for Thirsk.

44226998183023387.Text: You have pledged to slay the Udyrfrykte, %PCClass. Search the creature's lair on the eastern shore of Lake Fjalding, just to the west of here.

2389612666516621037.Text: *Yawn!*  Ah, hello, my friend. You are well, I hope? I've been trying to get some sleep, but it's not easy out here in the cold. Thirsk is closed for repairs, so I've lost my bed. The Udyrfrykte did quite a lot of damage. The mead hall will stay closed, too, unless someone is strong enough to claim the chieftain's throne. I'd do it myself, but I'm too damned tired to bother.

71382752095631387.Text: %PCName!  I've had some time to rest, and am ready to grant your reward. As a sea captain, I discovered many hidden places, one of which is a magnificent ice dungeon called Gyldenhul. It lies on a small island off the northeast coast of Solstheim, not too far from here, actually. The dungeon is loaded with riches, and I want you to have it all. Take this key -- the door is heavily locked. Oh, and I'll mark the dungeon on your map. Now I must get back to sleep.  Thanks again!
Script: MessageBox "Thormoor has marked Glydenhul on your map."

2206617259636225661.Text: My goodness, I feel so silly wearing this bear armor.  I know, I look quite ridiculous.  But at least it will keep me warm while I'm outside waiting for Thirsk to reopen.  I'm not a Nord, you see.  I'm a Breton.  I'm a bookseller by trade, but my real passion is writing.  The Solstheim Nords are my area of expertise, you might say. I recently finished two scholarly works -- Thirsk, a History and Sovngarde, a Reexamination.  I have copies of both for sale, among others.

598329492382618646.Text: It was horrible, %PCName!  I had finally found someone interested in my custom snow bear armor and snow wolf armor.  We were talking about prices, when suddenly this hideous black beast came up from the ice lake.  It...it killed my customer!  Then it went inside the mead hall!  I heard screaming...sounds of battle!  Then the thing came out again, pierced with arrows!  It headed back toward the lake but first it came back for my customer and dragged off his body!

125496956243006655.Text: All hail %PCName, the new chieftain of Thirsk! My lord, I can provide you with something fitting of your new position.  Provided with enough gold and the right materials, I can make sets of custom snow bear armor and snow wolf armor worthy of a chieftain.

159314428136815855.Text: Use whatever magicka you used to get in here and get out!  The mead hall is closed!  We've got a lot of work to do and don't need you in our way.  If you can't use your fancy spells then maybe you can just squeeze out through the main doors.  They're boarded up on the other side to prevent people like you from getting in, but I think you can make it through.  Now get going, before I get nasty!

2586935333272195.Text: Use whatever magicka you used to get in here and get out!  The mead hall is closed!  We've got a lot of work to do and don't need you in our way.  If you can't use your fancy spells then maybe you can just squeeze out through the main doors.  They're boarded up on the other side to prevent people like you from getting in, but I think you can make it through.  Now get going, before I get nasty!

335259792230710527.Text: Use whatever magicka you used to get in here and get out!  The mead hall is closed!  We've got a lot of work to do and don't need you in our way.  If you can't use your fancy spells then maybe you can just squeeze out through the main doors.  They're boarded up on the other side to prevent people like you from getting in, but I think you can make it through.  Now get going, before I get nasty!

14681182612655820574.Text: My thanks for escorting me back to the Imperial Cult Shrine! If you haven't already, make sure you talk to Jeleen. He'll want to reward you for your duty.

12929163652040127428.Text: Do you want me to wait here, or should we travel together back to the Imperial Cult Shrine at Fort Frostmoth?

467367331887231260.Text: Should we travel together back to the Imperial Cult Shrine at Fort Frostmoth?

6309235882859827991.Text: So, no luck in finding Mirisa, %PCName?  I'm telling you she's out there.  Try the Skaal Village or that mead hall. Maybe they've seen her.

31538600023142163.Text: By the Nine Divines, you rescued my Mirisa!  Please take this gold.  I know it's not much, but it's all we have in our coffers.  I wish I could give more.  Mirisa is invaluable, to me and the Imperial Cult.

1367432453257539404.Text: Thanks once again for rescuing Mirisa, %PCName.

507621247194488840.Text: My...my Mirisa is dead?  No!  It...it cannot be!  Oh, why have the Divines forsaken me?  Mirisa was so young, so innocent!  %PCName...I thank you for relaying this information, tragic as it may be.  I'm sure you did everything in your power to help my love.  Please, take this gold as payment for your services.  Now if you don't mind, I wish to be alone.

2917293572459128614.Text: You...you need services?  Oh, oh yes, of course....

1468828391285326070.Text: Hail, %PCName.  Have you come to order a piece of custom snow wolf armor or snow bear armor?

3138974363113112316.Text: Thank you again for helping my family. Tell my father I will return to him one day, and make him proud.

9924196552157422842.Text: Hello, mighty chieftain of Thirsk!  The mead hall is better than ever under your leadership.  I still have works to sell, if you're interested.

329037752319230405.Text: Hello, my lady!  I have a gift for you...just a little something.  I've written a revised edition of my history of Thirsk, and would like for you to have the first copy.  It chronicles your valiant battle against the Udyrfrykte, and adds you to the list of chieftains.  May you rule over Thirsk for years to come!

1025816887259352400.Text: Hello, my lord!  I have a gift for you...just a little something.  I've written a revised edition of my history of Thirsk, and would like for you to have the first copy.  It chronicles your valiant battle against the Udyrfrykte, and adds you to the list of chieftains.  May you rule over Thirsk for years to come!

57903233324780393.Text: It is so good to see you again, %PCName.  Thanks to you, I am able to resume my duties here at the Imperial Cult Shrine.  I have potions and spells for sale.  Some will help potect against the brutal cold, and others can cure the disease carried by some of Solstheim's native fauna.

2576631603145445885.Text: We know that Hircine has tasked you, %PCName. Until you have done your master's bidding, the ritual may not proceed.

484411224126427947.Text: We know that Hircine has tasked you, %PCName. Until you have done your master's bidding, the ritual may not proceed.

9809321641547319923.Text: We know that Hircine has tasked you, %PCName. Until you have done your master's bidding, the ritual may not proceed.

162299851160111529.Text: Congratulations, %PCName.  You have survived the Rite of the Wolf Giver and have been cured of your lycanthropy.  Never again will you turn into a werewolf, and never again will you contract the disease.

12377286181877211643.Text: There is nothing more I can do, %PCName!  You must kill the werewolf to cure your lycanthropy!

1091322887126638188.Text: Yes! Yes!  There is just one last step, %PCName.  I must now recite the final incantation.... [The Witch of Glenmoril Wyrd utters another series of arcane, unintelligible words.]  Behold, the innocent lives again!  The woman has been given a part of your lycanthropy!  Kill the werewolf, and your curse will be ended forever! He he he he he he he he he he!

9387872647229403.Text: Put the Heart of the Wolf inside the innocent's corpse!  Do it now! He he he he he he he he he he!

955897542081531163.Text: That's it!  Now, I will pour the Glenmoril brew over the innocent's heart.  The heart must get wet...soaked.  Yes, there we go. Now, to recite the proper incantation.... [The Witch of Glenmoril Wyrd utters a long, shrieking series of arcane words.  The heart pulses in her hand, as if infused with new life.] There!  It is done!  The heart has been properly bewitched.  Now, place it back in the corpse of the innocent.  Do this, and then speak with me again.  You are almost free of your curse.  Almost....

19875228011675215932.Text: Kill the innocent!  Bring me her heart!  Do this, or you shall be cursed to walk the earth as a werewolf for all time!

1165936382809311282.Text: Greetings, %PCName.  The Rite of the Wolf Giver is almost complete.  Behold the innocent on the Altar of Thrond. Beautiful, isn't she?  One of the locals, a very nice specimen.  She still lives, but barely.  Your next step is simple.  You must kill the innocent, remove her heart, and bring it to me.  There is a dagger on the altar, but any weapon will do.  Did I not tell you the Rite of the Wolf Giver requires the sacrifice of both innocence and flesh? He he he he he he he he he he!

311362637304151291.Text: You've already brought me the petals of the wolfsbane flower, %PCName.  Now please, I have much work to do.  The brew is delicate.  One wrong miscalculation and you may end up turning into a warthog every night.  We wouldn't want that, now would we?

5889241981581724200.Text: Ah, %PCName, you have returned, and with the petals of the wolfsbane flower.  Very impressive.  The petals will be added to the cauldron, and infuse our brew with the essence of the wolf.   I see you have also completed my sister Isobel's task as well.  Excellent.  Speak now with Ettiene to learn what you must do next.

2460824750292320440.Text: Ah, %PCName, you have returned, and with the petals of the wolfsbane flower.  Very impressive.  The petals will be added to the cauldron, and infuse our brew with the essence of the wolf.  Remember, you must also complete my sister Isobel's task as well before talking to Ettiene.

3840166842579815587.Text: Return to me when you have obtained the petals of the wolfsbane flower.

3125513759232317176.Text: In order for the Rite of the Wolf Giver to proceed, my sisters and I need the petals of a wolfsbane flower. Wolfsbane is rare, and grows on Solstheim in only one place. You must go to the southern end of the Moesring Mountains, to the top of Hvitkald Peak. There you will find a single wolfsbane flower in bloom. Retrieve the petals of this wolfsbane flower and return them to me. Take this Rising Force Potion. You may need it to reach the peak.

11116232311664414400.Text: Speak first with our sister Etienne.  She is the point of the dagger.  The piercing of body and mind begins with her.

14323239272016023277.Text: You have already brought me the ripened belladonna berries, %PCName.  I must add them to the brew, yes.  Did you know that belladonna is also referred to as deadly nightshade?  When properly prepared, it is one of the deadliest posions in existence!  He he he he he he he he he he he he he he!

30218232982178859.Text: You have brought me a bunch of ripened belladonna berries.  Well done, %PCName.  The berries will be added to our cauldron, and sweeten the brew with the flavor of death.  I see you have also completed my sister Fallaise's task as well.  Excellent.  Speak now with Ettiene to learn what you must do next.

1533430381324316159.Text: You have brought me a bunch of ripened belladonna berries.  Well done, %PCName.  The berries will be added to our cauldron, and sweeten the brew with the flavor of death.  Remember, you must also complete my sister Fallaise's task as well before talking to Ettiene.

270698672567531374.Text: Return to me when you have obtained a single bunch of ripened belladonna berries.

231671119666316135.Text: The Rite of the Wolf Giver requires one bunch of ripened belladonna berries.  Unripened berries won't do, I'm afraid.  You can find ripened belladonna berries on belladonna plants that grow near Solstheim's burial barrows, for they thrive on death.  The Spriggan creatures have also been known to possess them, on occassion.  When you have one bunch of ripened belladonna berries, return it to me.

2268836521546619855.Text: Ah, you have spoken with Ettiene. Good. Now, speak with my sister Fallaise. When she has given you an errand, speak with me again, and I will do the same.

1899850763150515008.Text: Speak first with our sister Etienne.  She is the point of the dagger.  The piercing of body and mind begins with her.

301728337299361119.Text: Meet me at the Altar of Thrond, %PCName.  There we will continue the Rite of the Wolf Giver.

2657956771005824445.Text: So, you have completed your tasks for my sisters.  Excellent.  We will use those ingredients to concoct a certain potion.  But it is not for drinking, no, no.  It is for something...else.  Meet me at the Altar of Thrond and I will tell you what you must do next.  Certain preparations have already been made.  The cure is within your grasp, %PCName, but the final and most difficult steps lie ahead.

31100152802542360.Text: Complete the two errands for my sisters Isobel and Fallaise.  When you have done this, return to me.

38721025319147544.Text: Complete the two errands for my sisters Isobel and Fallaise.  When you have done this, return to me.

1968722521104241728.Text: Complete the two errands for my sisters Isobel and Fallaise.  When you have done this, return to me.

1958829156534316737.Text: Your cure begins here, %PCName.  The Rite of the Wolf Giver is a complex ritual of dark magicka, requring the sacrifice of both flesh and innocence.  My sisters and I will begin the preparations, but there are certain items that must be gathered.  My sisters Isobel and Fallaise will tell you what is needed.  When you have completed your errands for them, come speak to me again.

183889573301595775.Text: An interesting choice. Most who are offered the lycanthropy cure take the opportunity, without question. Very well. If you find the burden of the wolf too much to bear, return to me here at the Altar of Thrond and ask once more for my help.

21479162602739011662.Text: Fool!  I offer you a chance at purity, a chance to rid you of your curse, and this is how I am repaid?!  You shall know the power of the Witches of Glenmoril Wyrd!

20028215261505331399.Text: Very well.  You have chosen to cure your lycanthropy and forever end the call of the wolf within.  The road before you is a difficult one, for ridding oneself of lycanthropy is not so easy as merely sipping a potion.  But first, you must meet my sisters, and together we shall tell you of the Rite of the Wolf Giver.  Come.

2625812234612818919.Text: Greetings, %PCName.  Does my form surprise you?  As a witch of Glenmoril Wyrd, I have the ability to change my shape as suits my needs.  But then, you know something of shapechanging, don't you?  That is why the Coven has come here to Solstheim.  We have been watching events unfold, and are well aware that lycanthropy is spreading.  For some this is a blessing.  For others a curse.  For those who wish, we offer a cure, one that forever stops the change into wolf form.  Does such a thing interest you?
Script: Choice "No, I'd like to keep my gift of lycanthropy." 1 "Yes, I'd like to rid myself of lycanthropy forever." 2

1974620815662713373.Text: Hail, friend! I hope you find our mead hall to your liking. If you're tired, grab a bedroll and go to sleep. We don't stand on ceremony here at Thirsk. We live like family, as it should be!

14351134701680925257.Text: Hail, good %PCName! Skjoldr Wolf-Runner is my name. I am the chieftain of Thirsk, and welcome you to our home.  You'll not find a better mead hall anywhere, not even in Skyrim. For one hundred years Thirsk has withstood all manner of attack, from the snow and hail to those infernal Rieklings. But the mead hall still stands, and its hospitality is unmatched. Please, stay and relax. Enjoy our fine drink, and seek shelter from the cold.  Here, my friend -- taste the nectar of Shor!

24831180701191731869.Text: *Burp!*  Arrgghh!  Welcome to Thirshk, %PCRace!  The mead is a shpecial blend, imported all the way from... *Burp!* Shkyrim!  Drink up!

875715130223979614.Text: *Burp!*  Welcome to Thirshk, my friend!  It'sh alwaysh great to shee a new Nord fashe!  The mead is a shpecial blend, imported all the way from... *Burp!* Shkyrim!  Drink up!

1387564322687427266.Text: Hail, stranger.  I am Ulfrun, and I welcome you to the mead hall of Thirsk.  So long as you behave yourself, we'll get along just fine.  If you want to buy some mead, just ask.  If you haven't already I suggest you introduce yourself to Skjoldr Wolf-Runner.  He's the chieftain of this mead hall, and will want to greet a new arrival.

30651148481191013316.Text: *Burp!*  Welcome to Thirshk, my friend!  It'sh alwaysh great to shee a new Nord fashe!  The mead is a shpecial blend, imported all the way from... *Burp!* Shkyrim!  Drink up!

29859244853096711707.Text: *Burp!*  Arrgghh!  Welcome to Thirshk, %PCRace!  The mead is a shpecial blend, imported all the way from... *Burp!* Shkyrim!  Drink up!

30898312061131229691.Text: Please, stranger, help me! I'm being held prisoner by that disgusting Nord, Erich! I came to the mead hall to preach the way of the Nine Divines, and this is how I was repaid!

276291311955117.Text: Maybe where you're from it's all right to enter someone's chambers and play with their things, but it's not all right around here!  The missionary is MINE, understand? I knew you were trouble when I first laid eyes on ya!  Now I'm going to have to teach you some manners!

809230293913530589.Text: Stranger, please help me!  I was headed to the Imperial Cult Shrine at Fort Frostmoth when I lost my way. I entered this dungeon seeking shelter from the snow, but must return home. Can we travel together, with you acting as my escort?

378313757304572196.Text: Please, stranger, you must help me return home! May we travel together back to the Imperial Cult Shrine at Fort Frostmoth?

332313450127732401.Text: I know that Hrothmund has granted you his blessing, for I could feel it in the air. The heart of the Udyrfrykte has been placed on the pedestal for all to see. You, %PCName, are the new chieftain of Thirsk! Ruling the mead hall is great work, and I understand you may have business elsewhere. I offer to serve as your advisor and second-in-command, and will oversee the mead hall's affairs in your absence. Now, do we have any mead hall business to discuss? Or maybe you'd like to relax in your quarters?

1543117011493730448.Text: Ha!  Sorry, but you can't sneak up on me, %PCName!  I'm a ghost, thanks to you! By helping me die valiantly you showed my soul the way to Sovngarde!  My friends -- Hunroor, Erlendr, and Nikulas -- have been waiting for me.  I told them of our glorious battle!  The four of us wish to give you a reward fitting of such a warrior.  So, we give you a piece of ourselves.  Lay your hands on a stone, and you will receive that warrior's greatest attribute!  Now farewell, my friend! Sovngarde awaits!

3187114073240217891.Text: %PCName!  I've had some time to rest, and am ready to grant your reward.  As a sea captain, I discovered many hidden places, one of which is an ancient barrow called Gyldenhul. It lies on a small island off the northeast coast of Solstheim, not too far from here, actually. The barrow is loaded with riches, and I want you to have it all. Take this key -- the door is heavily locked. Oh, and I'll mark the dungeon on your map. Now, I must get back to sleep.  Thanks again!
Script: MessageBox "Thormoor has marked Glydenhul on your map."

11203143882288523240.Text: So, you've been sent by Thormoor Gray-Wave, have you?  What's the matter, is the poor shipmaster feeling a bit fatigued?  Does he wish he could get just a moment's rest?  I can't say I blame him.  Being cursed with eternal wakefulness can be rather unpleasant, or so I'd hoped.

306558367283551458.Text: Ah, hello there, %PCClass.  My thanks again for your help.

24339102903166518373.Text: Ah, hello there, %PCClass.  My thanks again for your help.

267486912570821701.Text: Ha!  That's the spirit, %PCName!  But as you see, I'm already dead!  By helping me die valiantly you showed my soul the way to Sovngarde!  My friends -- Hunroor, Erlendr, and Nikulas -- have been waiting for me.  I told them of our glorious battle!  The four of us wish to give you a reward fitting of such a warrior.  So, we give you a piece of ourselves.  Lay your hands on a stone, and you will receive that warrior's greatest attribute!  Now farewell, my friend! Sovngarde awaits!

2496026593016923603.Text: Hello, %PCName.  I heard you've been speaking to Severia Gratius about the moon sugar investigation.  I'll do whatever I can to assist you, of course.

299563659137321293.Text: He he!  Ha ha!  Can it be?  A visitor in my workshop?  How can I help you, sweet %PCName?  I have candy treats to spare, if you come in search of happiness!  Oh, so you're here to ask me about the moon sugar investigation! I see, I see, he he he he he he!

878012961581219033.Text: Oh...oh, of course.  I understand...understand completely...that is, you have my complete...total confidence.

2832523848372830114.Text: The airship...crashed? Horrible, horrible...such a loss of time...and money!  Oh, yes...yes...human life, too.  Mustn't forget the crew...people, after all.  Well...I am thankful...grateful really, that you've come to me with...um...with this information.  But...ah...%PCName...you know, there's um...still the matter of the amulet, you see.  I really must have...NEED, to be more accurate, the um...Amulet of Infectious Charm....

1982823872207639745.Text: The...the amulet has been...found?  You have actually recovered...and brought, to ME...the Amulet of Infectious Charm?  Oh, how wonderful!   %PCName, I am always...and I mean forever...in your debt!  Here...please...take this gold.  It's the very least...the smallest...thing I could do.  You know, I do...that is, I am curious...to know what has happened to the...well, to the airship.  After all, it did cost...I mean, a LOT of gold was invested....

2928142442266112825.Text: The airship...crashed?  Smashed...was dashed into the mountains?  Horrible, horrible...such a loss of time...and money!  Oh, yes...yes...human life, too.  Mustn't forget the crew...people, after all.  Well...I am thankful...grateful really, that you've come to me with...um...with this information.  And...ah...incredible work with the finding...that is, the recovery...of, um...the Amulet of Infectious Charm.....  My thanks, %PCName!  Here, please...take...have this gold!

1893132216245345653.Text: The...the amulet has been...found?  You have actually recovered...and brought, to ME...the Amulet of Infectious Charm?  Oh, how wonderful!   %PCName, I am always...and I mean forever...in your debt!  Here...please...take this gold.  It's the very least...the smallest...thing I could do.

3085020120919420943.Text: The airship...crashed?  Smashed...was dashed into the mountains?  Horrible, horrible...such a loss of time...and money!  Oh, yes...yes...human life, too.  Mustn't forget the crew...people, after all.  Well...I am thankful...grateful really, that you've come to me with...um...with this information.

12047271161461222385.Text: Oh...oh, of course.  I understand...understand completely...that is, you have my complete...total confidence.  I know it's just a...well...just a matter of time....

157722948085823215.Text: The airship...crashed?  Horrible...such a loss of time...and money!  Oh, yes...human life, too.  So tragic.  Well...I am...grateful really...that you've given me this information.  But you know, there's um...still the matter of an amulet.  The...Amulet of Infectious Charm....  It's what the...the crew was looking for.  I'd pay for it....  Search in Hrothmund's Barrow.  But...well...say the right name!  "Ondjage!"  The wolf!  If you don't...well, the barrow will be sealed...forever!

895040931970927504.Text: Aha!  %PCName, my old friend!  Wonderful to *cough* see you again.  Did I ever tell you how magnificently you *cough* performed your duties?  Locating the airship, returning the *cough* amulet...simply marvelous.  Thanks to you, Louis Beauchamp is an *cough* absolute lady killer!  Blondes, brunettes, red heads -- I'll take 'em all...and they can't resist me!  Ha!  It's a shame I've got this *cough* fever.  It's starting to slow me down!  Well, got to run.  I've got a *cough* hot date!
